Unsere Vielfalt - Ihre Chance
Als stärkste Regionalbank Österreichs setzt die Raiffeisenlandesbank OÖ auf Menschen, die ihre Gestaltungskraft, ihre Verantwortung und Motivation einbringen. Ihnen steht ein großes Spektrum an Berufsbildern und Karrierechancen mit interessanten Aufgabenstellungen, die weit über das Kernbankgeschäft hinausgehen, zur Verfügung. Wir bieten engagierten Persönlichkeiten zum ehestmöglichen Eintrittszeitpunkt im Ausmaß einer Vollzeitbeschäftigung folgende Position:
Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Risikoorientiertes Meldewesen
Dienstort: Linz
Tätigkeitsschwerpunkte
Laufende Analyse, Qualitätssicherung und Weiterentwicklung von Konzerndaten, welche in das interne und das externe Berichtswesen einbezogen werden
Ausführung, Qualitätssicherung und Weiterentwicklung der im Einsatz befindlichen SQL-Abfragen, mit dem Ziel der Sicherstellung einer laufenden Fortentwicklung
Mitbegleitung und mittelfristige Übernahme von eigenständigen, fachspezifischen Datenanalyseaufgaben, wobei auch Datensystem- und Datenintegrationstests mitbegleitet werden
Entwicklung von neuen Datenarchitekturen auf Konzernebene, welche für die Umsetzung neuer Datenanforderungen benötigt werden
Ihre Qualifikationen
Abgeschlossenes Studium der Wirtschaftsinformatik, Informatik, Mathematik, Statistik oder vergleichbare Ausbildung (IT-HTL, Erfahrung als Datenanalyst)
Gute Kenntnisse über Datenbankdesign, Datenmodelle und SQL
Analytisches Denkvermögen und ausgeprägtes Zahlenverständnis
Selbstständige und flexible Arbeitsweise
Soziale Kompetenz, Teamfähigkeit und Freude in einem eingespielten Team eine langfristige zentrale Aufgabe zu übernehmen
Unser Angebot
Abwechslungsreiches und herausforderndes Aufgabengebiet
Dynamisches Team, welches Sie in Ihrer fachlichen Entwicklung unterstützt
Attraktives Gesamtpaket an und Sozialleistungen
Wir bieten ein marktkonformes Vergütungspaket mit attraktiven Sozialleistungen. Das Mindestjahresgehalt für diese Position beträgt EUR 35.837,76 brutto (inkl. Sonderzahlungen). Die tatsächliche Bezahlung entspricht Ihrer jeweiligen Qualifikation bzw. Berufserfahrung.
Wenn Sie in dieser Position eine Herausforderung sehen, bewerben Sie sich online.
Die zuständige Ansprechpartnerin, Lisa Hummer, Tel.: +43 732 6596 22552, wird sich umgehend mit Ihnen in Verbindung setzen.

Lisa Hummer, Tel.: +43 732 6596 22552,
wird sich mit Ihnen in Verbindung setzen.

DATA ANALYST (M/W)

REF-NR.: 135884

Geeignetes Personal wird immer mehr zum Schlüsselfaktor für innovative Unternehmen. Unsere Techniker und Spezialisten (m/w) aus den Bereichen IT, Engineering sowie Human Technology unterstützen Unternehmen bei der Umsetzung ihre innovativen Projekte.

IHR AUFGABENGEBIET
Datenaufbereitung, Mustererkennung und Darstellung von Fahrzeugmessdaten mit dem Fokus auf automatisiertes Fahren
Teilprojektkoordination in R&D- und Kundenprojekten
Abstimmung der Datenschnittstellen mit Kunden und Lieferanten
Mitwirken an der Planung von Fahrzeugversuchen
Dokumentation und Berichtswesen
UNSERE ANFORDERUNGEN
Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium (Uni / FH / TU) mit dem Schwerpunkt Telematik, Informatik, Elektrotechnik oder vergleichbar
Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung
Kenntnisse im Bereich von Fahrzeugbussystemen
Grundkenntnisse im Bereich Cloud Computing und Big Data
Einschlägige Erfahrung mit Fahrerassistenzsystemen von Vorteil
Programmierkenntnisse in C, C++, C# und Python
Kenntnisse bezüglich der grundlegenden Fahrerassistenzsysteme und der damit verbundenen Sensorik und Aktuatorik
Selbständige, eigenverantwortliche Arbeitsweise
Ausgeprägte Kommunikations- und Teamfähigkeit
Führerschein B
Sehr gute Englischkenntnisse
Dienstreisebereitschaft
UNSER ANGEBOT
Dauerstelle mit fachlichen und persönlichen Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten
Abwechslungsreiches Arbeitsumfeld eines international ausgerichteten Unternehmens mit entsprechenden Karrierechancen
Attraktive Sozialleistungen
Kantine
Erreichbarkeit mit öffentlichen Verkehrsmitteln
Parkmöglichkeiten
Das monatliche Mindestgehalt für diese Position liegt bei € 3.300,- brutto, wobei je nach Qualifikation und Erfahrung eine dementsprechende Überzahlung vorgesehen ist

Wenn dieses Angebot für Sie attraktiv ist, bewerben Sie sich bitte hier:

ZUM BEWERBUNGSFORMULAR FÜR JOB NR. 135884

Die zuständige Ansprechpartnerin, Nina Pichlbauer, freut sich auf Ihre Bewerbung und wird sich danach umgehend mit Ihnen in Verbindung setzen.
Um eine schnelle Bearbeitung Ihrer Bewerbung sicherzustellen, ersuchen wir ausschließlich um Online-Bewerbungen.

YOUR MISSION
As part of the Data Insights team you are empowering ready2order to become more data driven!
You will be involved in
Data Governance to ensure high quality data that other BI users can easily work with
Data Warehousing to maintain, expand and improve our single source of truth and its ETL processes
Business Intelligence where you provide Reports and Analysis and communicate your findings to stakeholders
Data Science - apply optimization models and predictive analytics to create sophisticated Data Insights
WITHIN 1 WEEK, YOU’LL
Complete the ready2order on-boarding bootcamp and learn about the company history, our business and where we are going.
Have coffee breaks with employees from different departments.
Meet your team.

WITHIN 1 MONTH, YOU’LL
Take a deep dive into our data, the infrastructure and our data governance processes.
Get to know our BI tool, best practices and company standards related to data insights.
Create your first ad-hoc reports and dashboards for key business stakeholders.

WITHIN 3 MONTHS, YOU’LL
Provide high quality data to other BI users by cleansing and transforming data within our BI tool using SQL.
Help establishing a Data Certification process.
Maintain descriptions for data and data related processes.

WITHIN 12 MONTHS, YOU’LL
Maintain and improve our ETL tool (Java).
Apply predictive analytics in BI reports.
Help building optimization models and tools.

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCES TO BE ready
You have a degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Software Engineering or similar field of study
You have +2 years of professional experience in data analytics/business intelligence or a related field.
You are an expert with SQL.
You have coding experience in Java, Python, R or another language.
You are familiar with ETL processes and data warehousing.
You have strong analytical, organizational and communication skills.
You are a motivated team player who can work independently.
You have very good oral and written communication skills in English. German language is an advantage.

Vision
Our vision is to become the top of mind standard for managing a small business. We create a central access to all essential tools, entrepreneurs really need to unleash the full potential of their business.

Ihre Aufgabe

So unterschiedlich unsere Aufgaben auch sind, bei Magenta Telekom verfolgen wir alle dasselbe Ziel: mit ständig neuen Ideen, Produkten und Prozessen lösen wir das ultimative Versprechen für die digitale Zukunft Österreichs ein und gestalten und vereinfachen dadurch das Leben der Menschen.

Für unsere neu gegründete, österreichische Schwestergesellschaft "Magenta Telekom Infra GmbH" suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Eintrittstermin einen Data Analyst (m/w/d). Mit rund 35 MitarbeiterInnen verantwortet die Magenta Telekom Infra GmbH die gesamte passive Mobilfunkinfrastruktur.

Im Bereich Finance kümmern wir uns um die Buchführung und Finanzgebarung, die Finanzplanung und das Reporting für die Magenta Infra GmbH. Als Data Analyst sind Sie Teil des Finance Teams und bauen die Brücke zwischen operativen Business, der Finanz und der IT.

Ihre Aufgabe

• Erstellung, Zusammenführung und Analyse von Unternehmens- und Marktdaten aus verschiedenen Datenquellen
• Aufbereitung von Daten und Erstellung von (Potenzial-)Analysen für nationale und internationale Projekte
• Weiterführende Erstellung und Analyse von unterschiedlichen Szenarien und Forecasts
• Sicherstellung der Datenintegrität und Durchführung von Konsistenzchecks
• Laufendes Reporting und Datenbankbetreuung

Mehr Informationen



Ihr Profil

• Abgeschlossene technische/kaufmännische Ausbildung
• Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in einer vergleichbaren Position
• Erfahrung im Umgang mit relationalen Datenbanksystemen und SQL-Abfragen
• Erfahrung in der Mobilfunkbranche von Vorteil
• Sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse
• Vernetztes und ganzheitliches Denken, sowie Teamfähigkeit

Abhängig von Ihren Qualifikationen und Erfahrungen bieten wir für diese Position ein attraktives Bruttojahresgehalt, das bei mindestens € 45.000,- liegt.

Mehr Informationen



Benefits



Über uns

Wir sind Magenta.

Mit Magenta gestalten wir eine digitale Zukunft, die Sinn stiftet und Freude bringt, die spannend und aufregend ist, fasziniert und inspiriert. Magenta ist nicht nur eine Farbe oder ein Name, sondern vielmehr eine Vision: Das ultimative Versprechen für die digitale Zukunft Österreichs. Magenta ist eine Marke von Magenta Telekom (T-Mobile Austria). Das Unternehmen besteht aus rund 2.500 Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeitern. Als Teil der Deutschen Telekom Gruppe profitieren wir von der Innovationskraft und der finanziellen Stabilität des Konzerns, einem der global größten Player im Telekom-Markt. Wir machen modernste Technologie angreif- und erlebbar, brechen mit alten Gewohnheiten und setzen neue Maßstäbe. Damit wir den Alltag unserer Kunden bereichern und vereinfachen können.

Wir leben eine offene und tolerante Kultur, sind überzeugt, dass Unterschiede Vorteile sind und vielfältige Blickwinkel uns als Unternehmen bereichern. Wir bauen auf ein wertschätzendes, vertrauensvolles und offenes Miteinander und stehen dabei aktiv für Diversität ein. Diskriminierung hat keinen Platz in unserer Welt. Dabei geht es nicht nur um das Thema Geschlecht und/oder Alter. Wir verstehen Diversität gesamthaft. Wir fördern kulturelle Vielfalt, Vielfalt von individuellen Stärken und Fähigkeiten und Vielfalt in Lebensphilosophien.

Innovative, mutige und engagierte Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter sind für uns ein wesentlicher Erfolgsfaktor. Deswegen bieten wir Ihnen bei Magenta viele spannende Möglichkeiten. Wir sind Magenta. Sie auch?

Gehaltsinformationen
Das Mindestgehalt für diese Position beträgt € 50.000 brutto/jährlich. Das tatsächliche Gehalt ist abhängig von Qualifikation und Erfahrung.
Über Hays
IT-Spezialisten haben gute Karten – denn Hays sucht für Unternehmen aus der Wirtschaft und dem öffentlichen Sektor engagierte Experten, die gerne über den eigenen Tellerrand blicken und an ihren Herausforderungen wachsen. Wir stellen sicher, dass Sie von unserer langjährigen Erfahrung in der IT-Personalvermittlung profitieren und mit uns passende Aufgaben finden – und das völlig kostenfrei für Sie. Red Bull GmbH, Human Resources, Am Brunnen 1, A-5330 Fuschl am See, www.redbull.at/jobs. We are looking for a Senior Big Data Engineer to join our team. The primary focus of this role is to design multi-tenant data lakes for our Partners, doing statistical analysis and building high quality prediction tools.

To be successful in the role, you'll have the following technical skills and experience:
Commercial experience in delivering large enterprise level big data solutions in an extremely fast-paced and extreme agile environment
Ability to propose solutions and strategies to our business challenges
Collaborating with senior stakeholders to identify opportunities for leveraging data to drive growth
Provide thought leadership and up-skilling of a team of experienced developers
Hands-on coding experience with big data platforms; Spark, Scala, Python, Kafka
Event-driven systems, streaming and real-time analytics
Have used relational and NoSQL databases and cloud based micro-service infrastructure
Good communication, presentation, organisational skills; including the ability to manage changing priorities and meeting deadlines
You will find yourself working alongside talented, driven people who will push you to learn and excel. We focus on the important things and get them done.

We have a casual friendly entrepreneurial working environment, a flat organisational structure (where everyone is accessible on a day to day basis) and a technology stack, which is cutting edge. There will be opportunities for problem solving and innovation; where your contribution can have a significant impact.

As a Senior Big Data Engineer at swipejobs, you will be based near Milsons Point in a modern office with great views and get free lunch.

If you are talented, driven and interested in joining us in our journey; we would like to hear from you.

Please note: all applicants must have valid Australian working rights

ABOUT THE JOB

The Data Engineer is responsible for the maintenance and the improvement of all the data flows in the data and analytics platform(s). The Data Engineer designs and develops scalable ETL packages and routines from the source systems in order to create datasets, defining and building the data pipelines.

The Data Engineer additionally analyzes complex data elements and systems, data flows, dependencies, and relationships in order to contribute to conceptual physical and logical data models.

Your tasks among others will be:

- Managing end to end data pipelines to source and transform data to the Data & Analytics Platform(s).

- Integrating new data sources (internal and external) by creating a full pipeline from ingestion to ETL process.

- Delivering Data Provisioning to operational applications requiring transformation of data from several sources.

- Optimizing and expanding the Data & Analytics platform data flows and data models, supporting the Data Scientists or Business Intelligence Manager in deploying analytics products.

- Assessing the stability, robustness and efficiency of the implemented ETL processes and data pipelines and eventually re-design them.

- Gathering requirements and writing technical specifications document.

- Ensuring and monitoring high data quality standards with focus on data consistency.

- Timely resolving incidents related to data interfaces and ETL processes.

- Expanding the current Data & Analytics platform to embed “big data” capability by investigating and sharing best practices.

ABOUT YOU

We are looking for a motivated talent, who brings along the following background:

- 3-5 years of professional experience in Data Engineering, Business Analytics and related fields.

- Excellent knowledge and proven professional experience with the SAS software suite, especially SAS Data Integration Studio and SAS Management Console and / or big data tools (Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, Alteryx, …) as well as cloud services and / or SAP BW (data warehouse).

- Professional experience and conceptual knowledge of building and maintaining physical and logical data models.

- Ability to think beyond technology requirements to build ONE logical Data & Analytics platform.

- Well structured, analytically thinking and demonstrating the ability to explain processes in a clear and understandable manner to a non-technical audience.

- System management expertise with monitoring, disaster recovery, backup, automated testing, automated schema migration, and continuous deployment.

- Excellent interpersonal communication and presentation skills.

- Self-driven, flexible, open minded professional and proactive team player who ensures implementation towards agreed goals and timelines.

- Ability to take ownership and proven strive for excellence.

- Fluency in English.

ABOUT SWAROVSKI

Swarovski is a family-run company, founded more than 120 years ago in Wattens, Austria. We are leading group of global companies committed to stable growth and maintaining our place at the forefront of design, creativity, and technological innovation.

Working for Swarovski is more than just a job. You will work for a groundbreaking, modern, premium brand, which is globally known for its quality and creativity. We place people at the heart of our business and offer global pay programs, supported by a range of local benefits. In addition, we provide rich development opportunities which recognize and reward the brilliant contributions of our passionate individuals and teams who contribute to the success of our company – sparkling every day.

As required by law, we advise that the collectively agreed base monthly salary for this position is set at a minimum of € 2.357,32 gross. Our actual salaries are market competitive and take individual qualifications and experience into account.

Are you passionate to contribute with enthusiasm to our success? Then we are looking forward to receive your job application!

job_title_orig: Applied research scientist, Speech Recognition – Language modeling
job_description:
Nuance is the pioneer and leader in conversational artificial intelligence (AI) innovations that bring intelligence to everyday work and life. We deliver solutions that understand, analyze, and respond to people, amplifying human intelligence to increase productivity and improve security. With decades of both domain and AI expertise, we work with thousands of organizations across a wide range of industries.
Join our team! At Nuance, we are constantly reinventing how people connect with technology and with each other. Our AI-powered solutions empower organizations to transform “business as usual.” For decades, the world’s leading financial, healthcare, telecommunications, retailers, and government organizations have trusted Nuance to bring them award-winning solutions that deliver more meaningful outcomes and empower a smarter, more connected world. From clinical speech recognition technologies that free physicians to spend more time caring for patients to real-time intelligence that powers billions of customer interactions, we’re deeply committed to helping organizations push the boundaries of what’s possible.

Summary:
In this position, you will work with a multi-disciplinary and highly motivated team of scientists and engineers, most of which are based in Vienna, Austria. You will help us improve our machine learning and speech recognition technology for clinical documentation solutions. This technology impacts the daily work of healthcare providers and is used in products such as Nuance Virtual Scribing Services and Dragon Medical One.
Principal duties and responsibilities
Train and optimize language models for speech recognition
Apply the latest research results, investigate and understand differences between alternative approaches
Implement and improve tools, algorithms, and prototypes
Define metrics, prepare data sets, run experiments, analyze, evaluate
Work closely together with a team of speech recognition experts and present results and ideas to peers and managers
Education
Education:MSc. or PhD in Computer Sciences, Computational Linguistics, Speech Recognition, Machine Learning, or similar fields like Physics or Mathematics, or equivalent work experience
Years of Experience: 3+
Required skills
Hands-on experience with modern speech recognition technologies like DNNs and RNNs
Experience with TensorFlow or similar frameworks
Experience with scripting languages such as Python
Fluency with Unix/Linux, shell scripting
Good written and spoken communication skills
Preferred skills
Solid machine learning background
Experience in C++
Linguistics

Nuance offers a compelling and rewarding work environment. We offer market competitive salaries, bonus, equity, benefits, meaningful growth and development opportunities and a casual yet technically challenging work environment. Join our dynamic, entrepreneurial team and become part of our continuing success.

job_title_orig: Junior Consultant (all genders) Digital Analytics (Machine Learning, Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Big Data, Cloud Computing)
job_description:
Deine Persönlichkeit und Individualität machen den Unterschied. Im Team von Accenture steigern wir die unternehmerische Leistungsfähigkeit unserer Kunden und weisen ihnen den Weg ins digitale Zeitalter. So auch im Bereich Digital: Hier verbessern wir das Leben von Millionen von Menschen – als Impulsgeber noch nie dagewesener digitaler Produkte und Lösungen. Und hier verstärkst du unserer Applied-Intelligence-Team.

Das ist genau dein Ding? Lebe deine Leidenschaft in einer Position, in der Du mit State-of-the-Art-Technologien weltweit aufgestellte Unternehmen dabei unterstützt, aus ihren Daten neue und verbesserte Geschäftsmodelle zu entwickeln. Wir agieren hierbei industrieübergreifend, sodass du täglich Neues dazulernst und deine Karriere ein ganzes Stück weit nach vorne treiben kannst.

Make Accenture More You
Mithilfe von Cloud Strategien und agiler Umsetzung gibst du unseren Kunden in folgenden Themenfeldern die Richtung vor:
Im Bereich Business & Sales fokussierst du dich auf die Identifizierung von Verbesserungspotenzialen innerhalb der Unternehmen sowie die anschließende Beratung zum optimalen Einsatz von Analytics-Lösungen. In diesem Zusammenhang entwickelst du Analysestrategien, Betriebsmodelle und Wertearchitekturen zur Monetarisierung der vorhandenen Daten
Im Bereich Delivery begleitest du unsere Kunden bei der Implementierung der erarbeiteten Analytics-Lösungen und verhilfst ihnen so zu einer einwandfreien Verwaltung, Bewegung und Nutzung großer Datenmengen. In diesem Rahmen erstellst du Performanceanalysen von Datenintegrationssystemen, überwachst das Datenqualitätsmanagement und integrierst heterogene Systeme in die neue IT-Systemlandschaft

Hiermit kommst du bei uns an
Abgeschlossenes (Master-) Studium der Mathematik, Informatik, Physik, Statistik oder Wirtschaftsinformatik bzw. eine vergleichbare Ausbildung
Erste Praxiseinblicke im Consulting oder in der Industrie
Die Fähigkeit, Probleme sowohl kreativ als auch mit scharfem analytischen Verstand zu lösen
Je nach fachlichem Background gute technische Grundlagen in einem oder mehreren der folgenden Themen:
Datenmodellierung (R, Python, Spark, Julia, SAS, SPSS, MATLAB)
Programmierung (Java, Scala, C++, HTML, CSS, Ruby, JavaScript)
Datenbanken (Oracle, Teradata, Sybase, MS SQL, Cassandra, MongoDB)
Big-Data- / In-Memory-Datenbanken (Hadoop, Cloudera, Hortonworks, SAP HANA, Graph DB, IBM IndoSphere)
Datenvisualisierung (PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik etc.)
Data-Warehouse / Informatica (PowerCenter, PowerExchange, MDM, IDQ, ILM, TDM, ILM)
Verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse, projektbezogene Mobilität, Kommunikationsstärke und eine hohe Kundenorientierung

Dein Kontakt

Du hast Fragen? Dann wende dich an unser Recruiting Team per E-Mail an recruiting_austria@accenture.com oder telefonisch unter 00800 45045045.

Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung über unser Online-Formular.

Neben spannenden Projekten bieten wir dir ein sehr attraktives Vergütungspaket, flexible Arbeitszeiten, ein modernes Umfeld und viele weitere zusätzliche Benefits. Du hast bei uns die Möglichkeit, basierend auf deiner individuellen Leistung aktiv dein Jahreseinkommen positiv zu beeinflussen, welches für diese Position bei einem Jahresbruttogehalt von 41.000 € startet. Gerne sind wir bereit je nach Qualifikation und Erfahrung ein höheres Gehalt anzubieten.

Proxygen develops therapies against cancer and other life-threatening diseases by reprogramming the cellular protein quality control system. Proxygen is focused on particular small molecules called 'molecular glue degraders' which mediate recruitment of a disease-causing protein to a ubiquitin ligase. Consequently, the target protein is ubiquitinated and directed to the proteasome for degradation. Hence, instead of merely blocking the function of harmful proteins, molecular glue degraders enable their complete, targeted and selective elimination. This outlines a clear avenue towards targeting otherwise undruggable proteins and is one of the most promising therapeutic innovations of the last decades.

Proxygen is located in the VBC6 Startup Labs, a new co-working space for biotech companies embedded in the Vienna Biocenter campus. Within this context, Proxygen aims to create a vibrant and dynamic work environment with a strong emphasis on collaboration and teamwork.

We are looking for an enthusiastic full-time PostDoc-level Data Scientist (f/m/d) excited to join our team!

The Candidate

The successful candidate will have the following qualifications:
PhD degree with a focus on molecular- or computational biology
Solution-oriented, persistent researcher with an independent, well-structured and goal-oriented working style
Proven scientific track record that includes at least one first author publication in one of the aforementioned fields
Experience in the design of high-content image-based screens and the development and optimization of automated image analysis pipelines
Proven expertise in machine-learning algorithms
Wet-lab experience or a track record in supervising technical assistants will be considered an advantage
Excellent written and oral communication skills (English) as well as high accuracy, reliability and excellent interpersonal and organizational skills
The Opportunity

At Proxygen, you will be working in a multidisciplinary team of scientists consisting of molecular biologists, computational biologists and chemists. All efforts will be aligned towards the common goal of improving therapeutic options for cancer patients by identifying, characterizing and optimizing small-molecule degraders of critical oncoproteins. Furthermore, the position offers the chance of progression into a team leader role with responsibility over 2-3 scientists.

Tasks & Responsibilities

Among others, the following tasks will be tied to the vacant position:
Development, implementation, execution and continuous optimization of a high-content analysis pipeline to measure drug-dependent modulation protein stability in a pooled format
Leading a team of additional scientists (wet- and dry-lab)
Internal training in data analysis
Responsibilities in overall data management
Contribution to communication/reporting with external pharma partnerships
The monthly minimum (gross) salary amounts to 3900 EUR. Salary and conditions are commensurate to the experience of the candidate.

Application details

Please submit your application, consisting of a detailed letter of motivation and curriculum vitae (including the contact details of two referees) to Matthias Brand (office@proxygen.com). If possible, please submit your application documents as a single combined PDF.

Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis until the position is filled.

Additional Information
Web site for additional job details

https://www.nature.com/naturecareers/job/data-scientist-fmd-automated-image-a...

Requirements
Offer Requirements
Skills/Qualifications

PhD

job_title: system engineer for big data & data science use cases

job_description:
Aiconic is looking for a data engineer to join our team based in Vienna. You will work with our growing team of data scientists, engineers, and hackers to solve interesting problems in finance and build novel products that improve experiences for business and consumers.

In this role, the ability to ship functional tools & systems quickly on a deadline is just as important as the ability to build systems that are robust, reliable, and maintainable. Having pretty much tried every data engineering tool at least once, you will have the ability to autonomously make architecture choices and contribute to the decision making process as part of the team, drawing heavily on your personal experience.

You care deeply about reproducible, scalable pipelines and clean data sets. You can write program logic in SQL (not that you'd want to). You can refactor an ETL project in a few days if provided with enough liquid motivation. You can take a pipeline that is behaving erratically and make it produce the same result every time. You understand how to communicate with machine learning researchers about your pipelines and tools and can teach them how to utilize them.

Must Have

B.S. in Computer Science or extraordinary aptitude as a data engineer or systems engineer

Knowledge of distributed systems like HDFS/Hadoop, horizontal database scaling

Expertise in data storage, movement, and management systems

Ability to write a memory efficient program

job_title_orig: Senior Scientist (m/f/d) for Urban Data Platforms
job_description:
We are Austria’s largest research and technology organisation and an international player in applied research for innovative infrastructure solutions. This makes us a powerful development partner for industry and a top employer in the scientific community. Our Center for Energy is seeking to hire new Ingenious Partners for our location in Vienna:
Senior Scientist (m/f/d) for Urban Data Platforms
Digital Resilient Cities
You are part of a team researching how urban data platform can improve urban development and management.
You work on smart city projects related to urban data platforms world-wide.
Your colleagues are from a wide range of urban related disciplines such as urban planners, geographers, data scientist, energy and water experts.
You design, acquire and lead national and European research and client projects for urban data platforms in smart cities.
You involve in the conceptional and technical implementation for platform-based services and applications.
You evaluate the developments in the field and shape our research agenda.
You actively engage in the European Innovation Partnership on Smart Cities and Communities, the FIWARE community and other relevant networks.
You build up the urban data platform topic as an integral part of the service portfolio of our unit.
You motivate, lead and develop an interdisciplinary team of researchers and supervise PhDs.
You are a node actively cooperating with all relevant experts and units within AIT.
As an internationally recognized expert in your field you receive invitations to conferences, book contributions and reviews.
Your qualifications as an Ingenious Partner*:
PhD or equivalent in Business Informatics, Geoinformatics, Urban Data Science or another relevant field
At least 10 years of relevant professional experience
Proven experience in successful project acquisition
Competence in leading and developing teams in a research environment
Excellent understanding of FIWARE
Excellent command of software architecture (incl. e.g. Micro Service Architectures, APIs, OGC services etc.)
Proven programming skills (Javascript, Python, SQL, etc.)
Strong network in relevant research community, standardization bodies and/or industry
Very good communication and presentation skills in English and German

What to expect:
The minimum gross annual salary according to the collective agreement is EUR 61.320,-. The actual salary will be determined individually, based on your qualifications and experience. In addition, we offer company benefits, flexible working conditions, individual training and career opportunities.

At AIT, the promotion of women is important to us - that's why we are especially looking forward to hearing from female applicants!

Please submit your application documents including CV, motivational letter and certificates online.

Data Engineer

Jobs

für den Standort Hagenberg (ca. 20 km von Linz) / Vollzeit

Das erwartet dich - Du:
planst und entwickelst eine optimale Daten-Architektur um eine qualitative Basis für Analytics und Machine Learning bereit zu stellen.
arbeitest eng mit Entwicklern und dem Produktmanagement zusammen um Datenanforderungen zu verstehen und umzusetzen.
entwirfst und erstellst neue Daten Extraktions-, Transformations- und Ladeprozesse von unterschiedlichen Datenquellen.
verwendest state-of-the-art Methoden um eine zukunftssichere, skalierbare Plattform bereit zu stellen.
Das bringst du mit - Du:
verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Informatik- oder Software-Engineering-Studium (HTL, FH oder Universität) oder gleichwertige Praxiserfahrung.
bringst ausgezeichnete Programmierkenntnisse in Java und anderen relevanten Sprachen wie Python (bevorzugt mit Spring, Hibernate oder Pandas) mit.
zeichnest dich durch strukturiertes und sorgfältiges Vorgehen sowie eine genaue und ergebnisorientierte Arbeitsweise aus.
arbeitest gerne im Team und nach agilen Prinzipien (SCRUM).
verfügst über sehr gute Deutsch- sowie gute Englischkenntnisse.
Das bekommst du von uns:
Großartige Projekte: Du bist Teil einer internationalen Erfolgs-Story mit österreichischen Wurzeln.
Flexibles Arbeitsmodell: Gleitzeit ohne Kernzeit und Homeoffice - deine Arbeit kannst du dir flexibel einteilen.
Freitag frei: Alle 14 Tage verlängern wir dein Wochenende mit einer 4-Tage-Woche.
Weiterbildung ist uns wichtig: Deshalb werden Besuche von Konferenzen und Ausbildungen gefördert.
Faire Entlohnung: Einstiegsgehalt bei entsprechender Qualifikation 3.120€ brutto (IT Kollektivvertrag, Spezielle Tätigkeit 1, Regelstufe) bei Vollzeitanstellung (38,5h / Woche). Eine Überzahlung ist bei entsprechender Qualifikation selbstverständlich. Wer gerne mehr arbeitet, kann zusätzlich eine Überstundenpauschale vereinbaren.

Deine Bewerbungsunterlagen schickst du bitte per Mail an karriere@bluesource.at.

“Wir freuen uns, dich zu einem Vorstellungsgespräch bei uns einladen zu dürfen."

Principal Scientist (f/m/d), Global Drug Development, Kundl&Schaftenau, Austria

500 million! That is how many patients we reach with our products every year, improving their lives. It is our aim to expand this to more than 1 billion – with your help and contribution as an Principal Scientist (m/f) in our team.

Your Responsibilities:

Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

• Design, plan, perform and documentation as well as statistical analysis and interpretation of scientific experiments to drive development of final drug product and manufacturing process for solid and liquid dosage forms applying QbD principles with special focus on rigorous DoE
• Assure highest international level of scientific excellence and rigor for the design of experiments / project steps. Pro-actively increase scientific excellence from the bench.
• Tech transfer according to current regulations and GMP to cGMP production sites according to global and local procedures
• Scientific training and development of other associates
• Ensure current regulatory, GMP and HSE standards are taken into account and adhered to as governed by local, state and federal regulations, laws and policies as well as Sandoz policies and directives

Minimum requirements

What you’ll bring to the role:

• PhD or PostDoc in chemistry, biochemistry, physical chemistry, organic chemistry, analytical chemistry or relevant natural sciences and min. 5 years hands-on industry experience in formulation, preformulation, deformulation and manufacturing process development
• Proficient in using statystical tools like Minitab. ASAPprime,, Design Expert, etc.
• Expert understanding of Data Integrity, cGMP, ICH guidelines and regulatory requirements
• Passion and excitement for furthering the science from the bench
• A track record of peer-reviewed publications demonstrating scientific success and ability to write in a scientifically sound manner
• Fluency in English, German is an Advantage

Desirable requirements:

• Open and engaged personality with a can-do mind-set and the ability to adopt to change
• IVIVC knowledge is an asset
• Good knowledge of relevant software tools (e.g. AsapPrime, Empower, Fusion, Zeneth, etc.)

Why consider Novartis?
750 million. That’s how many lives our products touch. And while we’re proud of that fact, in this world of digital and technological transformation, we must also ask ourselves this: how can we continue to improve and extend even more people’s lives?

We believe the answers are found when curious, courageous and collaborative people like you are brought together in an inspiring environment. Where you’re given opportunities to explore the power of digital and data. Where you’re empowered to risk failure by taking smart risks, and where you’re surrounded by people who share your determination to tackle the world’s toughest medical challenges.

We offer a market-competitive base salary in line with your qualification, experience and individual competencies. Additionally we offer an attractive incentive program, a modern company pension scheme, childcare facilities, learning & development options and worldwide career opportunities within the Novartis group. The base pay is composed of a market oriented excess payment and the respective amount according to the Austrian collective agreement (at least 51.180,50 EUR
er year on a full time basis)

We are Novartis. Join us and help us reimagine medicine.

Novartis are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons.

job_description:
The University of Vienna (20 faculties and centres, 178 fields of study, approx. 9.800 members of staff, about 90.000 students) seeks to fill the position from 15.10.2020 of a

Senior Scientist
at the Department of Behavioral and Cognitive Biology

The Department of Behavioral and Cognitive Biology announces a position for a senior scientist on the topic of Behavioral Primatology. The advertised position is located at the Primate Research Station Landskron in Carinthia. The position is provisionally limited to four years with the possibility of subsequent unlimited employment.

Duration of employment: 4 year/s

Extent of Employment: 20 hours/week
Job grading in accordance with collective bargaining agreement: §48 VwGr. B1 lit. b (postdoc) with relevant work experience determining the assignment to a particular salary grade.

Job Description:
We are currently looking for a highly talented and highly motivated senior scientist (post-doc) with a strong background in molecular behavioral primatology. In our research group we explore genetic basics on primate behavior. Teaching in the area of behavioral primatology (teaching assignment according to the collective bargaining agreement). Involvement in the department administrative tasks.

Profile:
Completed Doctoral/PhD in Biology. The successful candidate meets the following criteria:
• Experiences in teaching molecular behavioral primatology, analytical expertise in molecular biological methods to analyze genetic data from fecal samples
• Experiences in macaque research
• Candidates should be able to manage a molecular biological field lab at the Affenberg
• Candidates should have a publication track record in the field of primatology and anthropology

Excellent command of written and spoken English, very good organization skills, very good presentation skills, precision and diligence in laboratory work, highest level of motivation, excellent teamwork skills. (Associate) Principal Scientist Cancer Research (m/f/d)-2011205
THE POSITION


We are seeking a scientifically excellent principal scientist to join our Cancer Research team in Vienna as soon as possible. The ideal candidate will utilise deep knowledge of cancer biology and an extensive scientific network to lead a laboratory focussed on developing antibody programmes in areas of cancer biology to ensure delivery of a portfolio that provides maximum benefit to patients.

Present scientific data at internal and external meetings, and publish findings in peer-reviewed scientific journals

Breakthrough therapies and innovative healthcare solutions for both humans and animals

to join the Giulio Superti-Furga Laboratory at CeMM to work on the human “Mini-Cell” project funded by a grant of the “1000 Ideas Programme”

Period: December 2020 until November 2022

The Superti-Furga laboratory at CeMM in Vienna addresses the mechanisms by which cells respond to challenges that perturb homeostasis, may these challenges be drugs, changes in environmental conditions or viruses. When it comes to understand metabolism and the transporters that control environmental access to nutrients, a reduction in complexity would be advantageous. Is it possible to obtain a human cell with less genes?

We are currently looking for an experienced, highly motivated scientist with an interest in chromosome biology, synthetic biology, and molecular biology. We aim at recruiting an ambitious and particularly fearless scientist who wants to work with us on the generation of a human “mini-cell”.

This position is perfectly suited for a scientist with an excellent background in molecular biology and genomic engineering who is open for a 2-year position in an international, academic environment and who is eager to exercise her/his skills in this fascinating project.

The Project
The “mini-cell” project was recently granted by the Austrian Science Fund and it will allow us to investigate the cellular machinery and metabolism with reduced redundancy and complexity. The techniques used in this project will be synthetic cell engineering using CRISPR/Cas9 and other methods, fluorescence-activated cell sorting (FACS) and whole genome sequencing.
Within the project the project scientist will be the key personnel supported in part by a research technician. The project will be embedded in the research group of Giulio Superti-Furga at CeMM and it will make use of the in-house sequencing facility. The laboratory has experience with all techniques proposed within the project description and has a proven track record systems biology and genomic engineering.
Selected References:
Rebsamen M, et al. Nature. 2015 Mar 26;519(7544):477-81.
Köberlin MS, et al. Cell. 2015 Jul 2;162(1):170-83.
Bigenzahn JW, et al. Science. 2018 Dec 7;362(6419):1171-1177
Girardi E, et al. Nat Chem Biol. 2020 Mar 09; 16(4) 469-478
Heinz LX, et al. Nature. 2020 May 13; 581(7808) 316-322

Your Profile

PhD degree or extensive experience in a relevant field (e.g. molecular biology, biochemistry)
Excellent skill sets in performing and documenting experiments (e.g. molecular biology, cell culture, biochemistry)
Excellent skills in planning, designing and trouble-shooting cell-based assays
Experience in genome biology and sequencing data analysis are a plus
Team player with strong communication skills and a proactive mindset
Excellent command of English

We offer

Challenging position in a great team and in a meaningful, inspiring and international setting
Competitive salary: This position is remunerated with a minimum yearly (gross) salary of EUR 48.000,- on a full time base. The definite salary will be based on qualification and experience.
Being part of a thriving academic and social community in Vienna, one of the cities with the best quality-of life in the world
The CeMM employment contract includes full insurance (health, accident, pension) and a one-off payment for moving
CeMM’s HR department and administrative team offers support with relocation, visa applications, onboarding, family support, etc.

The Laboratory
The Superti-Furga laboratory consists of a highly collaborative team of 25 scientists from 10 nations. In the last three years, we published about 50 papers, among which 10% in Nature, Science and Nature sister journals. Please visit our lab’s website for more details: www.superti-furga-lab.at

The Institute
CeMM is a flagship institute for biomedical research in the heart of Europe, Vienna. CeMM is committed to highest scientific standards. The environment is very collaborative, dynamic and international. One of CeMM`s advantages is to be in close proximity to the Vienna Medical University Campus and the General Hospital (AKH). This allows the fruitful interaction of basic scientists with clinicians, and the use of models and cuttingedge technology to disease relevant biological questions. According to a study by The Scientist, CeMM is ranked as the best European place to work in Academia 2012, internationally CeMM appears at the fourth place. The official language at CeMM is English, and more than 48 different nationalities are represented at the institute. For more information please visit:
www.cemm.at

Application details
CeMM aims to promote equality of opportunity for all with the right mix of talent, competences and potential. We welcome applications from candidates with diverse backgrounds. Please apply online with your application documents (cover letter, CV and names and contact details of 2 referees):
https://cemm.jobbase.io/job/1nqr8mgj

Closing date for applications: 31 October 2020

to build and lead the New Technologies team and drive projects aimed at establishing Evotec GT’s cutting edge gene therapy technology platform, and to apply the platform for gene therapy discovery and development programs.

job_title_orig: Senior Scientist at the Department of European and Comparative Literature and Language Studies
job_description:
The University of Vienna (20 faculties and centres, 178 fields of study, approx. 9.800 members of staff, about 90.000 students) seeks to fill the position as soon as possible of a

Senior Scientist
at the Department of European and Comparative Literature and Language Studies

Reference number: 11382

On October 1, 2020, a new interdisciplinary master's program for "Digital Humanities" was established at the Faculty of Philological and Cultural Studies, which is also being conducted with the participation of other faculties of the University of Vienna.

It is located at the Institute for European and Comparative Linguistics and Literature at the Department of Digital Humanities, which is currently being established.

Extent of Employment: 40 hours/week
Job grading in accordance with collective bargaining agreement: §48 VwGr. B1 lit. b (postdoc) with relevant work experience determining the assignment to a particular salary grade.

Job Description:
Active participation in research, teaching and administration. This involves
Documenting and supporting projects and project applications in the field of digital humanities within Vienna University
Coordinating the syllabus of the Digital Humanities master’s course
Arranging for internships and Digital Humanities projects within the master’s course
Involvement in research projects
International publications and presentations
Responsibility for project applications and the acquisition of third-party funding
Independent teaching of courses as defined by the collective agreement
Supervision of students
Participation in evaluation measures and quality assurance
Involvement in the department administration as well as in teaching and research administration
Profile:
You hold a dissertation or PhD in the field of cultural (preferably philological or historical) studies or in a related field including an aspect of philological and cultural studies
You have the necessary subject-specific, methodological and didactic competence
High ability to express yourself both orally and in writing
Excellent command of written and spoken English
Good German language skills for study administration
Basic programming skills (Python)
Technical expertise in at least one of the following fields: statistical data analysis (e.g. Numpy, R), data archiving and search (e.g. Elasticsearch), data visualisation (e.g. Matplotlib) and web programming (e.g. HTML, CSS, Javascript)

job_description:
As a data engineer/ back-end developer at Meister, expect challenging projects as you help us develop new features, make technological updates and implement ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality. You will work closely with both our business data analysts as well as other back-end developers.

Requirements
1-3 years experience as a data engineer or back-end developer
Experience with setting up & maintaining scalable and robust data pipelines (ETL)
Expert in Python or Java, SQL
Experience with APIs
Bonus: Experience with airflow
Bonus: Experience with Google Cloud Products (BigQuery, Data Flow etc.)
Bonus: Experience with Non-Relational databases and streaming pipelines
Bonus: Javascript Knowledge
Good English skills
Good team and organizational skills
Curiosity, ability to grasp tasks quickly and solve problems independently
Our offer
small, highly motivated team
Competitive annual salary between 37.000 – 50.000 Euros gross, depending on experience
Strong focus on the personal and professional development of all employees
Take part in fairs and conferences (e.g. Google I/O)
Work independently and with the newest technologies
Startup atmosphere (BBQs on the roof, annual company retreats, …)
Location: Vienna, Austria
Hackfest

Annual team getaway, as well as Hacky Fridays every week to work on your personal projects.

Team Spirit

We really like the products, but also one another. Going out together, BBQs and much more can be part of the job for anyone who’d like to join!

Fitness

Weekly (non-compulsory!) runs at the Donau Kanal and in-office Yoga.

Personal Development

Meister supports you in your personal career development with detailed & ambitious paths within the company.

Flexibility

Although we have a pretty cool office, we also understand that you wanna work from home sometimes. You’re welcome with whatever hardware you’d like!

Games

We work hard and play hard. Our office is equipped with a pool table and a PS4.

Duties & Responsibilities
Develop and implement innovative up‐ and downstream process technologies for efficient manufacturing of oncolytic viruses
Actively transfer process technologies from bench to pilot scale within the development organization and support transfer to external contract manufacturing organizations (CMO)
Cultivation of mammalian cells in bioreactors, propagation, concentration and polishing of virus‐based biologics, development of active live virus formulations.
Active participation in the design, development, characterization and validation of analytical methods
Develop and maintain corresponding SOPs and batch‐specifications. Write project and study plans and sound scientific reports; data presentation and discussion in the project review team
Work in close collaboration with other project teams and external partners; scientific presentation of work in project meetings and scientific conferences
Train and supervise technical staff
Requirements
PhD in Biotechnology, Bioengineering, or equivalent, at least 3 years of PostDoc or industry experience
Profound expertise in manufacturing of virus‐based biologics, particularly in downstream processing; special knowledge in preparative chromatography and tangential‐flow filtration is an asset.
Used to work proactively with hands‐on approach in a highly entrepreneurial environment; scientific project management experience is an advantage.
Strong team player with excellent communication skills willing to work in a company where personal engagement and empowering combined with accountability is highly supported.
Evidence of scientific rigor and excellence as documented by first author peer‐reviewed publications.
The position requires excellent English communication skills, both spoken and written. German language skills would be highly appreciated (otherwise willingness to learn German).
Proficient in MS‐Office
Your Benefits
This function provides the unique opportunity to participate actively in the early development of novel virus‐based cancer therapies at the interface of science and translation. We offer a responsible and versatile occupation with professional perspective in an expanding team.
Work within the concentrated, science driven atmosphere of a small biotech company whilst at the same time benefit from being part of the global group of Boehringer Ingelheim, one of the pharmaceutical industry’s top 20 companies worldwide.

We offer an attractive salary package in line with your qualification, experience and individual competencies. The base pay is composed of a market oriented excess payment and the respective amount according to the Austrian collective agreement (at least € 55.000 gross per year/full‐time).
Who we are
ViraTherapeutics is a subsidiary of the Boehringer Ingelheim group of companies: a perfect symbiosis of big pharma and a biotech start-up vibe. Located in the beautiful city of Innsbruck, Austria – a great place to live and to work – our dedicated Research & Development team develops innovative viral-based immune-oncology treatment options.
Contact
ViraTherapeutics GmbH, Bundesstraße 27, 6063 Rum, Austria, www.viratherapeutics.com

We look forward to receiving your application via our application portal.

Please upload your electronic application (in English) in a single PDF file including CV and a complete list of publications, statement of research interests, and at least two reference letters.

We invite you to visit our career site! You will find there more interesting information, such as the application process or about our diverse divisions.

Not exactly the position you are looking for but for someone you know? You can still forward it to friends or colleagues who might be interested.

We are expanding rapidly and hence, we are seeking new, experienced and hands-on team members who think outside of the box (and are not afraid to share their thoughts), will deliver unique ideas and like to work in a fast-paced environment.

Your mission

As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will, with a proactive work ethic, contribute to the optimisation of existing concepts, enrichment of the data model with new sources and focus on various data mining approaches.
Your focus
Data querying and engineering with SQL
Optimise current and develop new Tableau dashboards and reports to help drive decision making at all levels
Analyse trends in our data and provide insights and explanation
Carry out business-relevant analyses in cooperation with various departments and the management teams
Help ensure the accuracy of our data structure and enrich our data model
Why you
At least 2 years of experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst
Excellent SQL knowledge, experience with MySQL considered a plus
Solid experience with Tableau or similar BI tools
Experience with Google Analytics
Strong skills in data engineering, analysis and visualisation
Experience in data mining/statistical modeling using R or Python considered a plus
Profound business understanding and analytical thinking skills
Degree in business informatics, statistics, mathematics or a comparable field
Why us

Come and join our international and collaborative work environment as we strive towards our vision of accelerating the transition to a tokenised world. Apply today to help shape the future of investing.

For this position the salary range lies between €49,000- €57,000 gross per year. Our final offer will depend on your skills and experience.

In addition, Bitpanda offers attractive benefits:
- Flexible working hours
- Latest hardware
- Lunch and gym discount
- Regular team events and a yearly team trip
- Modern office in the Viennese Fintech Hub
- Buddy programme
- Beginner German classes

For any questions, please check our FAQ
See you soon!

Principal Scientist (m/f/d), Global Drug Development, Schaftenau, Austria

799 million! That is how many patients we reach with our products every year, improving their lives. It is our aim to expand this to more than 1 billion – with your help and contribution as a Principal Scientist (m/f/d) in our development team.

Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
• Coordinate and lead all analytical activities of assigned projects

• Lead initiatives to ensure proactive compliance and continuous improvement

• Represent own technical function in teams and fulfill all project tasks and responsibilities related to the own subject area

We are now looking for an experienced Data Analyst that will be responsible for the delivery of data analysis and reporting services through the development of dashboards. Alongside this you will also provide actionable insights supporting the business to make strategic decisions.

The management of web and app analytics such as Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Facebook pixel and SDK implementation to industry best practices

Principal Scientist (m/f/d) - Downstream Process Development, Schaftenau, Austria

27! This is the number of people who work in Schaftenau on the development of Downstream Processes (DSP) for the manufacturing of biopharmaceutical drug substances.

Your Responsibilities:

Your responsibilities include, but not limited to:
• You will develop downstream processes for biopharmaceutical drug substances including new biological entities and biosimilars
• You will lead the DSP sub team for the projects in your area of responsibility in a matrix organization (organize and lead meetings, prepare minutes, define timelines and tasks) and provide scientific guidance and process optimization and characterization
• You will perform the successful technological transfer of our processes to production sites according to global and local procedures
• You will prepare and review technical documents including study protocols and reports, risk assessments and provide input for master documents
• You will align and collaborate with customers (e.g. Drug Substance Lead, Regulatory CMC, Quality Assurance, Production, Supply Chain)

• Master Degree in biotechnology, biochemical engineering, biology, chemistry, biochemistry or similar with at least 4 years strong relevant industry experience or PhD in relevant field and at least 1-2 years relevant industry experience
• Fluency in English
• Experience in development of chromatography steps, normal flow and tangential flow filtration steps; proven ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects
• A personality with a can-do mind-set and the ability to adopt to change with strong communication and presentation skills

job_title_orig: Praktikum Data Scientist (w/m) mit Python Knowhow
job_description:
A1 ist viel mehr als nur ein Telekommunikationsunternehmen. Als Teil der A1 Telekom Austria Group treiben wir die Digitalisierung in 7 Ländern mit innovativen Lösungen und neuen Geschäftsfeldern voran. Du bist auf der Suche nach einem Praktikum und möchtest gemeinsam mit uns die Zukunft gestalten, in der du leben willst? Dann bring dich mit all deinen Stärken ein und probiere Neues aus. Entwickle dich mit uns weiter. Make it happen.

Auf den Punkt gebracht

Praktikum bei A1 - eine Win-Win-Situation! Bei uns bist du ein vollwertiges Teammitglied. Wir gewinnen mit dir tatkräftige Unterstützung und du hast die Gelegenheit 6 Monate praktische Erfahrung zu sammeln und deine Fähigkeiten weiterzuentwickeln.

Die Gruppe Market & Competitors Analytics (MCA) verantwortet Performance-Reports und –Analysen, sowie die Entwicklung von internen Natural Language Processing (NLP) Lösungen.

Mit Spaß an der Arbeit, einem offenen Wesen und einer positiven Grundeinstellung bist du bei uns richtig!

Dein Praktikum

Gemeinsam mit unseren ExpertInnen entwickelst du Lösungen in den Bereichen NLP und Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR).

Lerne an echten Data Science und Machine Learning (ML) Anwendungen der Industrie.

Du bekommst Zugriff auf große Datenmengen und Cutting-Edge Hardware (GPUs) in der Cloud.

Du hast die Möglichkeit einen Teil deiner Arbeitszeit für die Vertiefung oder den Abschluss deiner wissenschaftlichen Arbeit zu nutzen, sofern diese einen thematischen Zusammenhang zum Praktikum hat.

Du bist bei uns richtig, weil …

du aktuell ein Studium oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung mit Schwerpunkt Computer Science, Data Science oder einem ähnlichen Gebiet absolvierst oder bereits abgeschlossen hast.

du erste Erfahrungen im Bereich Software Engineering mit Schwerpunkt Machine Learning (TensorFlow/PyTorch) mitbringst.

du bei BERT nicht vorrangig an einen Sesamstraßenbewohner denkst, sondern an eine Technik, die du zum Modellieren menschlicher Sprache einsetzen kannst.

du auf Details achtest, rasch Zusammenhänge erkennst und diese in den richtigen Kontext stellst.

du über sehr gute Deutsch- oder Englisch-Kenntnisse verfügst.

Besonders freuen wir uns über deine Bewerbung, wenn …

du gerne Neues probierst und keine Angst davor hast, auch mal zu scheitern.

Deine Benefits @ A1

Flexible Arbeitszeitgestaltung – von A1 Flexzeit bis Mobile Working

Best of both: Stabilität eines erfolgreichen Unternehmens mit innovativen Methoden

Eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten mit viel Gestaltungsfreiraum

Moderne Arbeitsatmosphäre und zentrales Office mit guter öffentlicher Anbindung

Constant Learning mit vielen Möglichkeiten & Angeboten

Bezahlte Mittagspause & Kantine, zusätzliche Urlaubstage und zahlreiche weitere Vergünstigungen

Wir bieten Dir die Chance, die Zukunft von Österreichs größtem Kommunikationsunternehmen aktiv mitzugestalten. Das kollektivvertragliche monatliche Mindestentgelt für dieses Praktikum beträgt EUR 2.288,62 brutto.

Wir bei A1 sind überzeugt, dass Frauen mit ihren Ideen und Arbeitsweisen unverzichtbar für unseren Unternehmenserfolg und unsere Kultur sind. Deshalb freuen wir uns besonders über Bewerbungen von Frauen und werden bei gleicher Qualifikation die Position mit einer Frau besetzen.

Als Teamplayer haben Sie Qualifikationen und Erfahrungen in Datenanalyse und Prognose und bereits IT-Systeme in Architektur und Infrastruktur für Big Data aufgebaut?

Nehmen Sie die Herausforderung an: Sie arbeiten in einem Experten-Team an hochwertigen Big Data & Analytics Lösungen und Produkten.In Zusammenarbeit mit Fachabteilungen erheben Sie Anforderungen hinsichtlich Datenanalyse und besprechen deren Umsetzung. Darauf basierend erarbeiten Sie Big Data Architekturen mit einhergehender Technologie-Entscheidungen (CAP-Theorem, Big Data vs. NoSQL, ...). Neben genannten IT-Themen erarbeiten sie Modelle zu analytischen Auswertungen (Statistische Auswertungen, Prognose-Modelle, Entscheidungsmodelle) und setzen dies mit gewählten Tools um. Die eingesetzten Technologien und SW-Produkte können von Anwendungsfall zu Anwendungsfall variieren und werden für jedes einzelne Projekt entsprechend den Anforderungen ausgewählt.

Vorausgesetztes Analytics Wissen: Data Acquisition Methoden, Analyse von strukturierten und unstrukturierten Daten, Deskriptive und explorative Statistik, Forecasting Methoden und Modelle, Know How in Decision Trees, Regressionen, aktuelle stat./stochastische Modelle, Tools-Erfahrung, z.B. R, SPSS, RapidMiner oder andere, Use Case Definition gemeinsam mit der Fachabteilung,Ausgepräge Problemlösungsorientierung

Vorausgesetztes Technologisches Wissen: Data Mining und Advanced Algorithmic, Big-Data Technologien (Cloud, NoSQL, Big Table, Map-Reducer), Big Data Architekturen: System-Architektur, CAP-Theorem, Design der Analytics Architektur, Kenntnis von Produkten wie Hadoop oder ähnliche (Big Tables, Streaming, Parallel/Batch Processing), Kenntnis von No-SQL/SparQL Datenbanken

Wünschenswerte weitere Fähigkeiten & Anforderungen: Erfahrung im Bereich von Engineering Prozessen, Automation und Prozess Design, Anwendung von Kundenspezifisch entwickelten System Developments Kits, Moderations- und Trainer Skills zur Durchführung von Workshops und Schulungen, Erfahrung mit ERP Systemen (SAP)

Einsatzort: Wien, Graz, International, mit mittlerer Reisetätigkeit,Jahresgehalt: ab 65.000.- Euro brutto, entsprechend Qualifikation Überzahlung gegeben

Wenn Sie auf der Suche nach innovativen, technologisch neuen und anspruchsvollen Herausforderungen abseits der traditionellen IT sind, freuen wir uns auf Ihre aussagekräftige Bewerbung an application@atlasinterim.com

Principal Scientist (f/m/d)– Downstream Process Development, Kundl, Austria

>200! This the current number of programs in clinical development at Novartis.
Many of these projects, which include new molecular entities as well as additional indications and different formulations for marketed products, are for medicines that could significantly advance treatment standards for patients worldwide.

Your Responsibilities:

• You will act as functional expert for (microbial) downstream process development for the assigned project(s) for biosimilars and/or new biological entities
• You are responsible for downstream process development activities incl. process development, -characterization and -transfer, know-how transfer etc.
• You will own the downstream process development deliverables
• You will work in cross-functional teams in a matrix organization
• You will need to communicate effectively across organizational interfaces i.e. project-/program-management; line functions etc.
• You will proactively identify scientific, technological and operational issues, propose creative solutions and communicate key issues to the appropriate management level

Minimum requirements

What you’ll bring to the role:
• Advanced degree (e.g. PhD) in biotechnology, bioprocess technology or biochemistry
• Excellent command of spoken and written English language skills
• Minimum of 3 years experience within the pharmaceutical industry, preferably in the field of downstream bioprocess development or manufacturing for biosimilars or new biological entities

Desirable requirements:
• Excellent organizational skills, team player, flexible and dedicated personality
• Ability to coordinate a number of tasks simultaneously, prioritize and deliver against tight timelines
• Excellent problem solving mind-set, attitude to resolve challenges, interdisciplinary thinking.
• Ability of properly balancing between efforts, risks and benefits
• Willingness to travel (<6x/a, 1 week/travel)

++ Wir bedauern sehr, dass unser Aufnahmeverfahren aufgrund der Covid-19-Pandemie nicht, wie es ansonsten unser Anspruch ist, rasch durchgeführt werden kann. Sie können versichert sein, dass wir Sie auf dem Laufenden halten und zeitnahe informieren. ++

At BIOMIN we harness the power of science to support animal health and performance. By applying state-of-the-art and proprietary technology we deliver natural, sustainable and profitable solutions to the livestock industry. For over 35 years we have pioneered innovative solutions for mycotoxin risk management and gut performance. BIOMIN is part of ERBER Group.

To further secure our rapid growth we are looking for the right person to fill our vacant position as
VALIDATION SCIENTIST (M/F/D)
THESE ARE THE TASKS WE TRUST IN YOU:
Support the analytics team with planning of analytical method validation and statistical analysis of data
Advise on method validation guidelines and procedures
Write method validation proposals and reports to ensure passing EFSA and FDA scrutiny
Summarize literature of mycotoxins and mycotoxin degradation products in animals
Support the regulatory team in communication with EFSA and FDA
Ensure collaboration of the project team members and timely delivery of results
TO LEAVE REAL 'FOODPRINTS' WITH US YOU NEED THE FOLLOWING SKILLS:
Scientific degree - chemistry, biotechnology, or similar
3+ years of experience in the field of analytical chemistry
Experience in analytical method validation
Enjoy writing and proofreading (eye for detail) of scientifically sound documents
Ability to collaborate across departments and work on multiple projects
Fluent English, excellent writing and presentation skills
Excellent communication skills, organization and planning skills, attention to detail
Knowledge of international feed safety regulations and in toxicology is an advantage
FDA related validation experience and LC MS/MS experience is an advantage

Here are some more good reasons to work for us.

job_title_orig: PROJECT SCIENTIST (m/f/x) to join the Giulio Superti-Furga Laboratory at CeMM to work on the human “Mini-Cell” project funded by a grant of the “1000 Ideas Programme”
job_description:
job_content_1

Period: December 2020 until November 2022

The Superti-Furga laboratory at CeMM in Vienna addresses the mechanisms by which cells respond to challenges that perturb homeostasis, may these challenges be drugs, changes in environmental conditions or viruses. When it comes to understand metabolism and the transporters that control environmental access to nutrients, a reduction in complexity would be advantageous. Is it possible to obtain a human cell with less genes?

We are currently looking for an experienced, highly motivated scientist with an interest in chromosome biology, synthetic biology, and molecular biology. We aim at recruiting an ambitious and particularly fearless scientist who wants to work with us on the generation of a human “mini-cell”.

This position is perfectly suited for a scientist with an excellent background in molecular biology and genomic engineering who is open for a 2-year position in an international, academic environment and who is eager to exercise her/his skills in this fascinating project.

The Project

The “mini-cell” project was recently granted by the Austrian Science Fund and it will allow us to investigate the cellular machinery and metabolism with reduced redundancy and complexity. The techniques used in this project will be synthetic cell engineering using CRISPR/Cas9 and other methods, fluorescence-activated cell sorting (FACS) and whole genome sequencing.

Within the project the project scientist will be the key personnel supported in part by a research technician. The project will be embedded in the research group of Giulio Superti-Furga at CeMM and it will make use of the in-house sequencing facility. The laboratory has experience with all techniques proposed within the project description and has a proven track record systems biology and genomic engineering.

Selected References:

Rebsamen M, et al. Nature. 2015 Mar 26;519(7544):477-81.

Köberlin MS, et al. Cell. 2015 Jul 2;162(1):170-83.

Bigenzahn JW, et al. Science. 2018 Dec 7;362(6419):1171-1177

Girardi E, et al. Nat Chem Biol. 2020 Mar 09; 16(4) 469-478

Heinz LX, et al. Nature. 2020 May 13; 581(7808) 316-322

Your Profile
PhD degree or extensive experience in a relevant field (e.g. molecular biology, biochemistry)
Excellent skill sets in performing and documenting experiments (e.g. molecular biology, cell culture, biochemistry)
Excellent skills in planning, designing and trouble-shooting cell-based assays
Experience in genome biology and sequencing data analysis are a plus
Team player with strong communication skills and a proactive mindset
Excellent command of English

We offer
Challenging position in a great team and in a meaningful, inspiring and international setting
Competitive salary: This position is remunerated with a minimum yearly (gross) salary of EUR 48.000,- on a full time base. The definite salary will be based on qualification and experience.
Being part of a thriving academic and social community in Vienna, one of the cities with the best quality-of-life in the world
The CeMM employment contract includes full insurance (health, accident, pension) and a one-off payment for moving
CeMM’s HR department and administrative team offers support with relocation, visa applications, onboarding, family support, etc.

The Laboratory

The Superti-Furga laboratory consists of a highly collaborative team of 25 scientists from 10 nations. In the last three years, we published about 50 papers, among which 10% in Nature, Science and Nature sister journals. Please visit our lab’s website for more details: www.superti-furga-lab.at

The Institute

CeMM is a flagship institute for biomedical research in the heart of Europe, Vienna. CeMM is committed to highest scientific standards. The environment is very collaborative, dynamic and international. One of CeMM`s advantages is to be in close proximity to the Vienna Medical University Campus and the General Hospital (AKH). This allows the fruitful interaction of basic scientists with clinicians, and the use of models and cutting-edge technology to disease-relevant biological questions. According to a study by The Scientist, CeMM is ranked as the best European place to work in Academia 2012, internationally CeMM appears at the fourth place. The official language at CeMM is English, and more than 48 different nationalities are represented at the institute. For more information please visit: www.cemm.at

Application details

CeMM aims to promote equality of opportunity for all with the right mix of talent, competences and potential. We welcome applications from candidates with diverse backgrounds. Please apply online with your application documents (cover letter, CV and names and contact details of 2 referees): https://cemm.jobbase.io/job/1nqr8mgj

Closing date for applications: 31 October 2020

We are Austria’s largest research and technology organisation and an international player in applied research for innovative infrastructure solutions. This makes us a powerful development partner for industry and a top employer in the scientific community. Our Center for Energy is seeking to hire new Ingenious Partners for our location in Vienna:
Scientist (m/f/d) for Urban Data Platforms
Digital Resilient Cities
You are part of the Digital Resilient Cities team researching how urban data platform can improve urban development and management.
You work on smart city projects related to urban data platforms world-wide.
Your colleagues are from a wide range of urban related disciplines such as urban planners, geographers, data scientist, energy and water experts.
You will guide the design, set up and management process of urban data platforms in smart city projects.
You will develop concepts, specifications and procedures for the technical implementation for platform-based services and applications.
You will act as an interface between the internal urban research team, external software developers and clients like city administrations, real estate developers and infrastructure operators.
You will actively engage in the European Innovation Partnership on Smart Cities and Communities and in FIWARE community.
You smoothly implement new platform-based services and applications.
You successfully develop research proposals for Horizon Europe and FFG projects and clients in the private and in the public sector.
You are a node actively cooperating with all relevant experts and units within AIT.
You publish your results in high-impact journals.
Your qualifications as an Ingenious Partner*:
MSc or PhD in Business Informatics, Geoinformatics, Urban Data Science or another relevant field
At least five years working experience
Excellent knowledge of software architecture (incl. e.g. Micro Service Architectures, APIs, OGC services etc.)
Proven programming skills (Javascript, Python, SQL, etc.)
Proven experience with FIWARE
Proven project management skills
Proven ability in project acquisition and research proposal writing
Very good communication skills in English and German

What to expect:
The minimum gross annual salary according to the collective agreement is EUR 52.584,-. The actual salary will be determined individually, based on your qualifications and experience. In addition, we offer company benefits, flexible working conditions, individual training and career opportunities.

At AIT, the promotion of women is important to us - that's why we are especially looking forward to hearing from female applicants!

Please submit your application documents including CV, motivational letter and certificates online.

AWS Training and Certification is seeking a driven, talented, and experienced Strategy Data Analyst to play a critical role in the Asia-Pacific and Japan (APJ) Training and Certification (T&C) team as we work to accelerate growth and customer satisfaction for AWS.


In this role you will be a part of the Sales Operations team, tasked with working with across AWS and T&C organizations to collect, organize, and analyze data critical to understanding the health of the T&C business. You will design and develop internal research and external industry analysis, as well as improving data integrity and financial reporting automation.

This role calls for a mix of operational and data analysis experience, strong overall business acumen, and collaborative skills.


You will be a key member of a growing Sales Operations team, reporting to the Sales Operations Manager. You will work closely with the Business Intelligence team to design critical health of the business reporting. The ideal candidate will have a background in analyzing and deriving insights from data by using SQL, analytics, and business intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau). A successful candidate should have the technical proficiency to leverage various software tools and reports and the business proficiency to summarize their findings and report to the AWS APJ Training and Certification leadership team. Strong writing and communication skills are a must to be successful in the role as is building trusted relationships with multiple key stakeholders globally.

· Conduct analysis of existing metrics and create new metrics that will be shared with the Business Management Team
· Work with the T&C Business Intelligence team to develop a new set of Business Management metrics and reporting
· Leverage internal tools including Tableau and AWS Redshift to deliver data driven recommendations, reports, findings, and presentations to internal stakeholders
· Provide operational support for data-driven initiatives led by the Operations team, identifying areas to develop or improve automation
· Design analysis framework to effectively answer strategic questions; collaborate with research and analytics partners including the Science and Economist team
· Perform hands-on financial, market, and customer data analysis to accelerate strategic studies



Basic Qualifications

· Bachelors degree in Finance, Business, Technology, or a similar discipline with analytical bias
· 5+ years of relevant work experience as a business analyst, financial or econometric analyst, or similar position requiring analysis
· 2+ years of experience using data driven analytics to support business decisions and translating data to relevant business insights
· Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Office (Excel, Word and PowerPoint)
· Experience with business intelligence and data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Tableau)
· Experience communicating and presenting to leadership or internal stakeholders, including workshops to gain requirements around key priorities
· Experience performing root cause analysis to uncover issues using data and reports

Preferred Qualifications

· Experience working with Sr. stakeholders, large complex organizations, and/or Executive teams
· Experience across the APJ region
· Experience working in a technology organization
· Demonstrated ability to work independently and self-motivate in a fast paced and rapidly-changing environment
· Demonstrated competency in the areas of group collaboration, analytical thinking and strategy

THE POSITION


Global Computational Biology and Digital Sciences (GCBDS) is a global organization across multiple sites at Boehringer Ingelheim: Vienna Austria, Biberach Germany and Ridgefield USA. With immediate effect, we are currently hiring a Computational Biology Principal Scientist in Vienna, Austria.

The computational biologist drives in-silico approaches for target discovery and validation primarily in the area of cancer research. Leveraging large public and proprietary multi-omics data sets in combination with functional read-outs (e.g., advanced CRISPR screens) enable the mining for novel therapeutic concepts. Access to some of the currently largest available patient cohorts augments the available data landscape. Team science is one of our core principles, so the successful applicant will work closely together with colleagues from both dry- and wet-labs.

Tasks & responsibilities

Analyzing and combining large-scale human data sets using state-of-the-art methods, ultimately leading to new therapeutic concepts
Presentation of results to internal and external stakeholders as well as working with top-tier academic institutes and CROs
