Excellent publication record
Proficiency in current state-of-the-art data science methods in the cancer domain
Profound knowledge of cancer biology
Proficiency with Linux environment, HPCs, cloud computing, and scripting languages
Your Benefits

Comprehensive health promotion, sustaining your health in the best possible way
Additional off-days (bridge-days) for more leisure time

Staff restaurant with a variety of lunch options for your daily well-being
We offer an attractive salary package in line with your qualification, experience and individual competencies. The base pay is composed of a market oriented excess payment and the respective amount according to the Austrian collective agreement (at least € 60,000 gross per year/full-time).

Breakthrough therapies and innovative healthcare solutions for both humans and animals

Talented and ambitious teams, living innovation and growing together
50,000 employees globally, 2,600 in Vienna

job_title_orig: Tech Developer (genomics): Research scientist with expertise and interest in developing cutting-edge genomics technology (single-cell, CRISPR, etc.)
job_description:
job_content_1

We are recruiting an ambitious scientist who wants to develop and apply cutting-edge technology for biomedical research . Key areas of interest include genome/epigenome profiling, single-cell sequencing, CRISPR technology, chemical biology, and synthetic cell engineering. The position will be based in the laboratory of Christoph Bock at the CeMM Research Center for Molecular Medicine of the Austrian Academy of Sciences in Vienna .

The Project

The successful applicant will identify and pursue opportunities for developing breakthrough genomics technology, in areas such as single-cell sequencing, CRISPR technology, epigenome editing, and mammalian synthetic biology. He or she will work with a small team of research technicians on establishing proof-of-concept for exciting new assays and technologies, and will collaborate with highly motivated PhD students and postdocs to demonstrate their impact for biology and biomedical research. Our laboratory has a proven track record in genomics technology development, which includes the CROP-seq method for CRISPR screening with single-cell RNA-seq readout ( Nature Methods 2017 ), ChIPmentation for low-input chromatin profiling ( Nature Methods 2015 ), scWGBS for single-cell DNA methylation profiling ( Cell Reports 2015 ), and scifi-RNA-seq for ultra-high throughput single-cell RNA sequencing ( bioRxiv 2019 ). Moreover, we are applying genomics technology to biomedical questions, for example in immunology (Nature 2020, in press; Science 2016 ), leukemia ( Nature Communications 2020 ; Nature Chemical Biology 2019 ), and solid tumors ( Nature Medicine 2018 ; Nature Medicine 2017 ). With the co-localized but separate team of the Biomedical Sequencing Facility , we serve a large medical campus with biomedical sequencing service, and we contribute to the Human Cell Atlas . Within this broader scope, specific projects will be developed together with the successful applicant, focusing on potentially groundbreaking ideas.

The Candidate

We are looking for candidates who want to be part of groundbreaking research and advance their scientific career in one of the most exciting areas of biomedicine. A typical background would be a PhD in molecular biology or a related field, with proven expertise in wet-lab technology development. Initial postdoctoral experience and relevant publications in the broader field of genomics technology development are a plus.

The Lab ( https://www.medical-epigenomics.org/ )

The Medical Epigenomics Lab at CeMM pursues interdisciplinary and highly collaborative biomedical research, focusing on the following areas:

Single-cell biology . Many diseases show deregulation of epigenetic cell states. As a member of the Human Cell Atlas , we use single-cell sequencing and human organoids to dissect the gene-regulatory foundations of cancer & immunity.
High-throughput technology . Many groundbreaking discoveries are driven by new technologies. We invest heavily into technology development, including single-cell sequencing, CRISPR screens, epigenome editing, and synthetic biology.
Machine learning . Huge datasets pose new analytical challenges. As a fellow of the European Laboratory for Learning and Intelligent Systems , we develop methods for interpretable deep learning and artificial intelligence in biology.
Immune cell engineering . CAR T cells have shown dramatic efficacy for blood cancers and may spearhead a broad shift toward personalized, cell-based therapies. We use high-throughput technology to design synthetic immune cells.

The Principal Investigator ( https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=9qSsTcIAAAAJ )

Christoph Bock is a principal investigator at the CeMM Research Center for Molecular Medicine of the Austrian Academy of Sciences. His research focuses on cancer and immunology, combining experimental biology with high-throughput technology and computational methods. He is also a guest professor at the Medical University of Vienna, scientific coordinator of the Biomedical Sequencing Facility at CeMM, group leader at the Ludwig Boltzmann Institute for Rare and Undiagnosed Diseases, and an elected member of the Young Academy of the Austrian Academy of Sciences. He coordinates the HCA|Organoid project pursuing single-cell analysis of human organoids, which constitutes part of the European contribution to the Human Cell Atlas, and he co-founded Genom Austria, a citizen science project that is the Austrian partner in the International Network of Personal Genome Projects. He has received major research awards, including the Max Planck Society’s Otto Hahn Medal (2009), an ERC Starting Grant (2016-2021), and the Overton Prize of the International Society of Computational Biology (2017). He co-founded Aelian Biotechnology, a Vienna-based startup company that develops and applies single-cell methods for high-throughput biology and drug discovery.

The Institute ( http://www.cemm.at/ )

CeMM is an international research institute of the Austrian Academy of Sciences and a founding member of EU-LIFE. It has an outstanding track record of top-notch science and medical translation (last few years: >10 papers in Nature/Cell/Science/NEJM, >25 papers in Nature/Cell sister journals). With ~150 researchers, CeMM provides a truly collaborative and personal environment, while maintaining critical mass and direct access to all relevant technologies. Research at CeMM focuses on cancer, inflammation, and immune disorders. CeMM is located at the center of one of the largest medical campuses in Europe, within walking distance of Vienna’s historical city center. A study by “The Scientist” placed CeMM among the top-5 best places to work in academia world-wide ( https://www.the-scientist.com/features/best-places-to-work-academia-2012-40676 ). Vienna is frequently ranked the world’s best city to live. It is a United Nations city with a large English-speaking community. The official language at CeMM is English, and more than 40 different nationalities are represented at the institute. CeMM promotes equal opportunity and harbors a mix of different talents, backgrounds, competences, and interests. We are offering an excellent employee benefits package including full insurance coverage (health, accident, retirement), health care services, daily bonus for the in-house cafeteria, relocation reimbursement, and an annual gross salary in the range of EUR 54,000 to 60,000 (depending on qualification and relevant experience).

Please apply online: https://cemm.jobbase.io/job/9fyeo3vp with cover letter, CV, academic transcripts, and contact details of three referees. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. Any application received by 5 August 2020 will be considered. Start dates are flexible.

job_description:
The University of Vienna (20 faculties and centres, 178 fields of study, approx. 9.800 members of staff, about 90.000 students) seeks to fill the position from 01.09.2020 of a

Coordinator
at the Research Platform Data Science @ Uni Vienna

Reference number: 10935

The research platform Data Science @ Uni Vienna has been in existence since 2018 and is growing rapidly. With 24 faculty members across 7 faculties, we are a very interdisciplinary group. We organize lecture series, summer schools, scientific meetings, retreats, and coordinate the three new master programs in Business Analytics, Data Science, and Digital Humanities. We are looking to fill the position of an institute coordinator. The main tasks are the support of the research platform in fulfilling its tasks and duties within the University of Vienna.

Fixed-term employment: 1 year. Extension of employment for the duration of the platform is possible and desired.

Duration of employment: 1 year/s

Extent of Employment: 25 hours/week
Job grading in accordance with collective bargaining agreement: §54 VwGr. IIIb with relevant work experience determining the assignment to a particular salary grade.

Job Description:
As a platform coordinator you will deal with the entire operative area of the Data Science Platform and form the interface between general and scientific staff as well as to the platform management. This includes the following tasks:
• Ensuring compliance with the framework conditions of labour law
• providing technical guidance to the platform’s general staff and coordinating personnel agendas
• Implementation of personnel development measures including the planning of necessary training measures
• Organisation and monitoring of the selection process for the recruitment of new employees

• Participation in the strategic planning/alignment of the platform (budget, resources and international networking): organisation of the collection of the information required for the decisions of the Board
• Planning, budgeting and implementation of relevant investment projects for the platform, ensuring the economical use of resources
• Organisation and securing of the communication structure for internal and external communication
• Further development and central organisation of the platform’s public relations work (incl. social media)

Profile:

• good command of English
• experience in organization / administration of conferences and graduate programs
• Experience in administration of research projects

• experience with a content management system (e.g. Typo3)

At BIOMIN we harness the power of science to support animal health and performance. By applying state-of-the-art and proprietary technology we deliver natural, sustainable and profitable solutions to the livestock industry. For over 35 years we have pioneered innovative solutions for mycotoxin risk management and gut performance. BIOMIN is part of ERBER Group.

In the gut performance further development role, you will work in a highly motivated team dedicated to developing innovative and sustainable feed additive solutions for the improvement of gut health, well-being and optimum performance of poultry, pigs, ruminants and aquaculture. You will use your technical knowledge to coordinate state–of–the-art in vitro and in vivo experiments and investigate the efficacy and mode of action of probiotics, phytogenics and acidifiers. Close collaboration and knowledge exchange with other departments and experts will keep your workday full of variety. Are you up to the challenge?

job_title_orig: Research Scientist in Proteomics and Chemical Proteomics
job_description:
job_content_1

The Winter laboratory at CeMM, the Research Center for Molecular Medicine of the Austrian Academy of Sciences in Vienna, is recruiting a postdoc-level researcher to develop novel strategies to target undruggable proteins for the treatment of cancer.

The Project : What is the “druggable space” in the human proteome? What proteins can actually be bound by small molecules? How can we determine the mechanism of action of hundreds of small-molecules in an unbiased manner to guide the innovation and characterization of next-generation anti-cancer therapeutics? We hypothesize that a much larger fraction of the proteome is amenable to novel paradigms in drug discovery. The successful applicant will work on these questions as part of- and supported by a multi-disciplinary research team at CeMM in Vienna, and in close contact with our partners at Pfizer in Cambridge/US. At this vibrant interface between academia and industry, the successful candidate has a unique opportunity to achieve a palpable translational impact.

The Candidate : The successful candidate holds a PhD degree in biochemistry, chemistry or computational biology. We are looking for a solution-oriented, persistent researcher with an independent, well-structured and goal-oriented working style. The candidate should have a scientific track record (including at least one first author publication) in the field of proteomics and deep know-how either in the generation (wet-lab) or the analysis (dry-lab) of proteomics/mass spectrometry data. A track record in supervising students or technical assistants would be an asset. The working language at CeMM is English, and excellent written and oral communication skills as well as high accuracy, reliability and excellent interpersonal and organizational skills are a requirement.

The Institute : CeMM is a biomedical flagship institute in the heart of Europe, Vienna. We are committed to highest scientific standards and provide an international environment representing approximately 40 nationalities. The working language is English. CeMM has been ranked by The Scientist as one of the Best Places to Work Academia worldwide (link: http://goo.gl/51VMO). In the past 3 years CeMM groups published numerous ground-breaking studies in prestigious journals such as Science, Cell, Nature, New England Journal of Medicine, Nature Immunology, Immunity etc. CeMM is located within the medical campus of Vienna and operates several technology platforms (chemical biological screening, proteomics, metabolomics, next-generation sequencing) as well as extensive bioinformatics infrastructure.

Your Application : Interested candidates are encouraged to upload their application documents (including a cover letter, a CV and names and contact details of at least 2 referees) online: https://cemm.jobbase.io/job/fvp25lux

Closing date for applications: 30 September 2020.

Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis until the position is filled.

Your future responsibilities
SAL IS LOOKING FOR RESEARCH ENTHUSIASTS IN THE AREAS OF:
Formal methods for modelling, verification and testing
Software Technology and Information Security
Security for embedded HW & SW in IOT
Embedded SW architecture, embedded AI systems, GPU and micro-controller programming

Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Reinforcement Learning
Statistical Signal Processing and Data Science

Your profile
WE HIRE...

Scientists/Researchers

You hold a PhD degree in related areas and you are fond of developing scientific methods and procedures as well as their application. Daily work includes collaboration with university and industrial research and/or development staff as well as being a sparring partner for and supervising of Junior Researchers. You are used to writing and reviewing (peer) research papers, reports, reviews and summaries. Openness to develop project ideas, concepts and coordinate small and medium-sized projects including preparation of research proposals and funding applications/bids is highly welcome.

BECOME PART OF SILICON AUSTRIA LABS

Austria's top research center for electronic based systesm (EBS).

Unfold the future, unfold yourself!
Important Facts
Beginning of the employment: as soon as possible

The position is endowed with a min. gross annual salary of € 56.000 depending on your experience and skills.
Become part of Silicon Austria Labs
The top research center for electronic based systems (EBS). Unfold the future, unfold yourself.

Pfizer employees around the world work together to improve the health of every individual everywhere. While we develop medicines and medical products and expand our business globally, we are always looking for new talents. We are currently looking for highly qualified candidates as

Responsibilities
In your new role, you will …
Support development and optimization of analytical methods for characterization of vaccines
Support evaluation of a clinical study
Support process development
Work in a matrix environment with local and global teams including members of analytical development, quality control and production
Present scientific data at internal meetings
Contribute to the development of new technologies

Requirements
MTA, BTA, Dipl. Ing. (FH) or B.Sc. in relevant field (e.g. Biology, Microbiology, Biotechnology)
Experience in cell culture, virological and immunological assays
Independent, well-organized and proactive work style
Ability to manage projects and prioritize tasks within projects
Excellent presentation and technical writing skills – fluency in English and German
Ability to comfortability drive results on your own or in a team

Your Benefits
Diverse career and development opportunities in a large international company
Comprehensive health promotion
A 24h accident insurance
Flexible working hours (exception shift work)
Staff restaurant
A free shuttle bus, which is available several times a day in both directions between the Donauzentrum in Vienna and the Orth an der Donau site (connection to underground lines 1 and 2).
The opportunity to become socially involved as part of Corporate Volunteering
An open, respectful corporate culture

We offer an attractive salary package in line with your qualification, experience and individual competencies. The base pay is composed of a market oriented excess payment and the respective amount according to the Austrian collective agreement (at least 36 433.04 € gross per year/full-time).

ViraTherapeutics is a subsidiary of the Boehringer Ingelheim group of companies: a perfect symbiosis of big pharma and a biotech start-up vibe. Located in the beautiful city of Innsbruck, Austria – a great place to live and to work – our dedicated Research & Development team develops innovative viral-based immune-oncology treatment options.

Our research team is looking for a highly motivated

Lab Scientist RNA Virology (m/f/d), full–time

Your role:

Independent work in research projects to optimize our proprietary oncolytic virus (OV) platform for (pre–) clinical development
Evaluation and optimization of new concepts in OV-based cancer immunotherapies
Cloning and recovery of recombinant OVs by classical reverse genetic approaches
Characterization of newly generated OVs with molecular and cell biology tests, and validation of new test methods
Creation and processing of standard operating procedures (SOPs), as well as project and study plans
Evaluation and documentation of results and data presentation in project teams
Support the BSL2 laboratory organization

Your qualification:

Master/diploma degree in biology, biochemistry or molecular medicine, professional experience in molecular virology of negative strand RNA viruses is an advantage
Good knowledge in mammalian cell culture and standard molecular biology techniques as well as recombinant DNA technology
Excellent self–organization, independent work in project teams
Reliability, commitment and communication skills
Very good English skills (international team)
Proficient use of MS‐Office

Our offer:

This position provides the unique opportunity to participate actively in the early development of novel virus‐based cancer therapies at the interface of science and translation. We offer a responsible and versatile occupation with professional perspective in an expanding team that has fun at work.
We offer an attractive salary and fringe benefits package in line with your qualification, experience and individual competencies. The base pay is composed of a market oriented excess payment and the respective amount according to the Austrian collective agreement (at least € 38.000 gross per year/full–time).

job_title_orig: Postgraduate Research Associate (project employment) / Forest Scientist for the optimisation
job_description:
The Department of Forst- and Soil Sciences, Institute of Silviculture at BOKU University is currently seeking a researcher for the project NOBEL to support our activities in developing business models and mechanisms to internalise the socio-economic value of forest ecosystems and implement a payments for forest ecosystem services scheme in various case studies all over Europe.

The applicant will support our activities in applying a web-based auctioning platform for the implementation of the business models. It is expected that a review of the concepts for payments for forest ecosystem services is done, and analysis for forest inventory data, the design of innovative forest management concepts to provide forest ecosystem services, the use of models to predict the effects of silvicultural measures and the spatial / temporal optimisation of silvicultural concepts on forest management level. Writing of publications, application of statistical (SPSS, R) and optimisation tools (Matlab, Solver, …), very good written and spoken German and English as well as GIS (spatial analytics, visualisation) is expected.

Gross monthly salary and pay grade in terms of collective agreement for university staff (payable 14 times per year): B1, € 2.929,00 (for 40 hours per week)

University of Natural Resources and Life Sciences Vienna seeks to increase the number of its female faculty and staff members. Therefore qualified women are strongly encouraged to apply. In case of equal qualification, female candidates will be given preference unless reasons specific to an individual male candidate tilt the balance in his favour.

Please send your job application to the Personnel department, University of Natural Resources and Life Sciences, 1190 Vienna, Peter-Jordan-Straße 70; E-Mail: kerstin.buchmueller@boku.ac.at. (Reference code: 171)

We regret that we cannot reimburse applicants travel and lodging expenses incurred as part of the selection and hiring process.

www.boku.ac.at
Additional Information
Additional comments

Please note that the full job description is only available in German.

Web site for additional job details

http://short.boku.ac.at/jobboerse

job_description:
ABOUT THE JOB

The Senior Data Engineer is responsible for the maintenance and the improvement of all the data flows in the data and analytics platform(s). The Senior Data Engineer designs and develops scalable ETL packages and routines from the source systems in order to create datasets, defining and building the data pipelines.

The Senior Data Engineer additionally analyzes complex data elements and systems, data flows, dependencies and relationships in order to contribute to conceptual physical and logical data models.

Moreover, the Senior Data Engineer acts as architect of the Data & Analytics platform defining the logical data model and the physical data model(s). He/She also keeps up with industry trends and best practices, advising the management on new and improved data engineering strategies.

Your tasks among others will be:

- Defining the optimal architecture of the Data & Analytics platform enabling the availability and re-usability of all required data for data science and reporting.

- Managing data pipelines to source and transform data to the Data & Analytics Platform(s)

- Integrating and transforming new data sources (internal and external) by creating a full pipeline from ingestion to ETL process.

- Delivering Data Provisioning to operational applications requiring transformation of data from several sources

- Optimizing and expanding the Data & Analytics platform data flows and data models, supporting the Data Scientists or Business Intelligence Manager in deploying analytics products

- Defining and document detailed Data Engineering processes to guarantee efficient building and support of the data & analytics platform

- Assessing the stability, robustness and efficiency of the implemented ETL processes and data pipelines and eventually re-design them

- Gathering requirements and write technical specifications document

- Ensure and monitor high data quality standards with focus on data consistency

- Timely resolving incidents related to data interfaces and ETL processes

- Expanding the current Data & Analytics platform to embed “big data” capability by investigating and sharing best practices

ABOUT YOU

We are looking for a motivated talent, who brings along the following background:

- min.8 years of professional experience in Data Engineering, Business Analytics and related fields.

- Excellent knowledge and proven professional experience with the SAS software suite, especially SAS Data Integration Studio and SAS Management Console and / or big data tools (Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, Alteryx, …) as well as cloud services and / or SAP BW (data warehouse)

- Experience with data modelling (conceptual, logical, physical) and data modelling documentation.

- Professional experience and conceptual knowledge of building and maintaining physical and logical data models

- Ability to think beyond technology requirements to build ONE logical Data & Analytics platform

- Well structured, analytically thinking and demonstrating the ability to explain processes in a clear and understandable manner to a non-technical audience

- System management expertise with monitoring, disaster recovery, backup, automated testing, automated schema migration, and continuous deployment

- Excellent interpersonal communication and presentation skills

- Self-driven, flexible, open minded professional and proactive team player who ensures implementation towards agreed goals and timelines

- Ability to take ownership and proven strive for excellence

- Fluency in English

ABOUT SWAROVSKI

Swarovski is a family-run company, founded more than 120 years ago in Wattens, Austria. We are leading group of global companies committed to stable growth and maintaining our place at the forefront of design, creativity, and technological innovation.

Working for Swarovski is more than just a job. You will work for a groundbreaking, modern, premium brand, which is globally known for its quality and creativity. We place people at the heart of our business and offer global pay programs, supported by a range of local benefits. In addition, we provide rich development opportunities which recognize and reward the brilliant contributions of our passionate individuals and teams who contribute to the success of our company – sparkling every day.

As required by law, we advise that the collectively agreed base monthly salary for this position is set at a minimum of € 2.969,24 gross. Our actual salaries are market competitive and take individual qualifications and experience into account.

Are you passionate to contribute with enthusiasm to our success? Then we are looking forward to receive your job application!

Atos ist ein führender Anbieter für die digitale Transformation mit circa 120.000 Mitarbeitern in 73 Ländern und einem Pro-forma-Jahresumsatz von rund 13 Milliarden Euro. Als europäischer Marktführer in den Bereichen Cloud, Cybersecurity und High-Performance Computing bietet die Gruppe end-to-end Orchestrated Hybrid-Cloud, Big Data, Business Applications und Digital Workplace Lösungen sowie Transaktionsdienste der Tochtergesellschaft Worldline, dem europäischen Marktführer in der Zahlungsbranche. Mit ihren Spitzentechnologien und ihrem Branchenwissen unterstützt Atos die digitale Transformation ihrer Kunden in allen Geschäftsbereichen.

Der Konzern ist der weltweite IT-Partner der Olympischen und Paralympischen Spiele. Atos firmiert unter den Marken Atos, Atos Syntel, Unify und Worldline. Atos ist an der Pariser Börse (CAC40) notiert.

Weitere Informationen finden Sie unter www.atos.net

Ihre Aufgaben

Unterstützung der Kunden auf Basis von Best Practices
Bindeglied zwischen Kunden, Vertrieb und Atos Delivery Organisation als wesentlicher Eckpfeiler für den Erfolg von Atos
Unterstützung des Vertriebs mit Wissen des Atos-eigenen Portfolios in den verschiedenen Bereichen
Eigenständige Durchführung von Kundenterminen und Veranstaltungen
Beantwortung von Ausschreibungen bis hin zu Projektimplementierungen

Ihr Profil

Laufendes relevantes Studium (Universität oder FH)
Idealerweise erste Erfahrung im Bereich Informations- und Knowledge Management
Awareness für aktuelle Herausforderungen bzgl. Big-Data/Analytics sowie Data-Governance
Ausgeprägtes Interesse für Hersteller, aktuelle Technologien und Produkte sowie aktuelle Markttrends
Technologische Expertise sowie Verständnis für betriebswirtschaftliche Anforderungen des Kunden
Hohes Maß an Eigeninitiative und Lernbereitschaft, sowie Offenheit & ausgeprägte Teamfähigkeit
Ganzheitliches, vernetztes und lösungsorientiertes Denken
Sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse

Wir bieten

Ein vielseitiges, anspruchsvolles und abwechslungsreiches Aufgabengebiet in angenehmer Atmosphäre und in einem kompetenten Spezialistenteam
Flexible Arbeitszeiten zur idealen Vereinbarkeit von Beruf & Studium
Training on the Job, sowie interne und externe Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Ein wertschätzendes und förderndes Arbeitsumfeld
Diverse Benefits und Vergünstigungen wie z.B. Gutscheinaktionen

In dieser Position übernehmen Sie eine verantwortungsvolle und spannende Rolle in einem engagierten Entwicklungsteam, in dem ständige Weiterentwicklung, wechselseitiger Austausch und Teamwork großgeschrieben werden. Sie werden Teil unseres globalen Delivery Teams und arbeiten einerseits eng mit Architekten, Beratern, Projektmanagern und andererseits mit den Ansprechpartnern im Vertrieb über verschiedene Länder hinweg zusammen.

Je nach konkreter Qualifikation und Berufserfahrung bieten wir Ihnen ein Jahresbruttogehalt ab € 25.000 sowie zahlreiche betriebliche Benefits.

Wir haben uns zum Ziel gesetzt, Diversität in unserem Unternehmen zu fördern. Wir freuen uns über eine Bewerbung, unabhängig von Geschlecht, Herkunft, Alter, Behinderung oder sexueller Orientierung.

Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Online-Bewerbung!

ViraTherapeutics is a subsidiary of the Boehringer Ingelheim group of companies: a perfect symbiosis of big pharma and a biotech start-up vibe. Located in the beautiful city of Innsbruck, Austria – a great place to live and to work – our dedicated Research & Development team develops innovative viral-based immune-oncology treatment options.

We are looking for an experienced, enthusiastic and creative

Principal Scientist Bioprocess Development (m/f/d), full-time

Your role:

Develop and implement innovative up and downstream process technologies for efficient manufacturing of oncolytic viruses
Actively transfer process technologies from bench to pilot scale within the development organization and support transfer to external contract manufacturing organizations (CMO)
Cultivation of mammalian cells in bioreactors, propagation, concentration and polishing of virus-based biologics, development of active live virus formulations.
Active participation in the design, development, characterization and validation of analytical methods
Develop and maintain corresponding SOPs and batch-specifications. Write project and study plans and sound scientific reports; data presentation and discussion in the project review team
Work in close collaboration with other project teams and external partners; scientific presentation of work in project meetings and scientific conferences
Train and supervise technical staff

Your qualification:

PhD in Biotechnology, Bioengineering, or equivalent, at least 3 years of PostDoc or industry experience
Profound expertise in manufacturing of virus-based biologics, particularly in downstream processing; special knowledge in preparative chromatography and tangential-flow filtration is an asset.
Used to work proactively with hands-on approach in a highly entrepreneurial environment; scientific project management experience is an advantage.
Strong team player with excellent communication skills willing to work in a company where personal engagement and empowering combined with accountability is highly supported.
Evidence of scientific rigor and excellence as documented by first author peer-reviewed publications.
The position requires excellent English communication skills, both spoken and written. German language skills would be highly appreciated (otherwise willingness to learn German).
Proficient in MS-Office

Our offer:

This function provides the unique opportunity to participate actively in the early development of novel virus-based cancer therapies at the interface of science and translation. We offer a responsible and versatile occupation with professional perspective in an expanding team.
Work within the concentrated, science driven atmosphere of a small biotech company whilst at the same time benefit from being part of the global group of Boehringer Ingelheim, one of the pharmaceutical industry´s top 20 companies worldwide.
We offer an attractive salary package in line with your qualification, experience and individual competencies. The base pay is composed of a market oriented excess payment and the respective amount according to the Austrian collective agreement (at least € 55.000 gross per year/full-time).

Contact:
Please send us your relevant application documents, including CV and certificates by email to jobs@viratherapeutics.com
ViraTherapeutics GmbH, Bundesstraße 27, 6063 Rum, Austria, www.viratherapeutics.com

Werde Teil des Digital-Teams der REWE International AG. In unserer Einheit RIAG Digital bündeln wir die gesamte technologische Weiterentwicklung aller Online-Aktivitäten mit besonderem Fokus auf den eCommerce und Omnichannel Bereich. Das Analytics Team Als Spezialeinheit innerhalb der RIAG Digital bündeln wir die technologische Weiterentwicklung aller Analytics-Aktivitäten und unterstützen unsere Stakeholder bei der Gestaltung ihrer digitalen Agenda. Innerhalb unseres engagierten Daten Teams arbeitest du an einer Grundlage für unsere neue Dateninfrastruktur und trägst die Verantwortung über die technische Umsetzbarkeit von Projekten. Zudem wird deine Zusammenarbeit mit anderen Teamkollegen durch Mentoring, interaktives Lernen und technischen Austausch von uns gefördert.

QUALIFIKATIONEN, DIE WIR BELOHNEN
Erfahrung mit einer Datenbank- oder Programmiersprache (SQL, Python, R, Java etc.)
Erfahrung in der Bereitstellung einer skalierten Daten- und Analyseplattform
Selbstständige und strukturierte Arbeitsweise
Hohe Eigenverantwortung und Fähigkeit, neue Technologien in einem schnelllebigen Umfeld zu erlernen
Erfahrung mit der Google Cloud Platform GCP oder ähnlichen Datenplattformen
Erfahrung mit der Erstellung von skalierbaren Data Pipelines
Vertraut mit kundenspezifischen ETL-Design und dessen Wartung
Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
HERAUSFORDERUNGEN, DIE SIE MEISTERN
Planung, Entwicklung und Umsetzung einer optimalen Data Architektur auf der Google Plattform, um eine qualitative Basis für Anwendungsfälle im Bereich Analytics und Machine Learning bereit zu stellen
Kooperation mit Analysten, Produktmanagern und Backend Entwicklern, um Datenanforderungen zu verstehen und umzusetzen
Unterstützung beim Entwerfen und Erstellen von neuen Daten Extraktions-, Transformations- und Ladeprozessen von unterschiedlichen Datenquellen
Verwendung und Sicherstellung von state-of-the-art Methoden (CI/CD), um eine zukunftssichere und skalierbare Plattform bereit zu stellen
ANGEBOTE, DIE SIE BEGEISTERN
Modernes Office mit Raum für innovative Ideen und abwechslungsreiche Meeting- und Arbeitsplatzgestaltung
Dynamische Startup-Atmosphäre mit allen Vorteilen eines führenden Handelsunternehmens
Essenszuschuss
Zahlreiche Ausbildungs- und Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten im Konzern

Für unseren Kunden aus dem öffentlichen Dienst in Wien suchen wir einen Analytics / Data Engineer (w/m). Eine sehr gute Reputation sowie eine sehr hohe Arbeitsplatzsicherheit und Stabilität zeichnen unseren Kunden als gefragten Arbeitgeber aus. Zusätzlich bietet unser Kunde ein angenehmes Arbeitsklima und gute persönliche Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten in einem agilen Umfeld mit modernen Technologien.

IHRE AUFGABEN:

Ihre Hauptaufgabe liegt darin, der Geschäftsführung eine qualifizierte datenbasierte Entscheidungsgrundlage zu ermöglichen, indem Sie alle relevanten Daten dementsprechend aufbereiten, verwalten und weiterentwickeln. Dies gelingt, indem Sie die Dateninfrastruktur im Hintergrund am Laufen halten und Ihre Teamkollegen damit unterstützen. Sie sind für die Pflege, Wartung und Überwachung der Dateninfrastruktur zuständig und kümmern sich um die Integration von neuen Datenquellen in das Datawarehouse. Sie erstellen Datenmodelle zur standardisierten Analyse von Daten und optimieren die Performance durch Anpassung von Abfragen oder Datenbankstrukturen.

IHR PROFIL:

Sie haben eine abgeschlossene einschlägige Ausbildung (HTL) oder ein Studium (Betriebswirtschaft, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Informatik oder technisches Studium) oder eine gleichwertige Praxiserfahrung. Ein technisches Verständnis von Big Data Infrastrukturen und Technologien sowie Interesse an weiterer Entwicklung in agilen Settings setzen wir ebenso voraus, wie Kenntnisse bzw. Erfahrung mit verschiedenen Softwarepaketen, relevanten Programmiersprachen und im Bereich Machine Learning (Scala, Python, Go und/oder Java). Sie haben hervorragende Datenbank-Kenntnisse und Erfahrung mit APIs sowie Microsoft SQL Analysis Services (Oracle, PostGres). Persönlich zeichnen Sie sich durch Ihre analytischen Fähigkeiten und Ihre strukturierte Arbeitsweise aus sowie eine gute Kommunikationsfähigkeit zur Präsentation von Analyseergebnissen. Sie haben einen konstruktiven und lösungsorientierten Zugang sowie ein hohes Qualitätsbewusstsein. Absolute Vertrauenswürdigkeit, überdurchschnittliches Engagement in Ihrer Tätigkeit und die Fähigkeit zur kooperativen Zusammenarbeit im Team runden Ihr Profil ab. Selbstverständlich sprechen Sie fließend Deutsch (und Englisch).

BDO Consulting GmbH
Mag. Birgit Meyer
Tel. +43 1 537 37-494
QBC4, Am Belvedere 4 | A-1100 Wien

At BIOMIN we harness the power of science to support animal health and performance. By applying state-of-the-art and proprietary technology we deliver natural, sustainable and profitable solutions to the livestock industry. For over 35 years we have pioneered innovative solutions for mycotoxin risk management and gut performance. BIOMIN is part of ERBER Group. To further secure our rapid growth we are looking for the right person to fill our vacant position as Validation Scientist (m/f/d) These are the tasks we trust in you: Support the analytics team with planning of analytical method validation and statistical analysis of data Advise on method validation guidelines and procedures Write method validation proposals and reports to ensure passing EFSA and FDA scrutiny Summarize literature of mycotoxins and mycotoxin degradation products in animals Support the regulatory team in communication with EFSA and FDA Ensure collaboration of the project team members and timely delivery of results To leave real 'foodprints' with us you need the following skills: Scientific degree - chemistry, biotechnology, or similar 3+ years of experience in the field of analytical chemistry Experience in analytical method validation Enjoy writing and proofreading (eye for detail) of scientifically sound documents Ability to collaborate across departments and work on multiple projects Fluent English, excellent writing and presentation skills Excellent communication skills, organization and planning skills, attention to detail Knowledge of international feed safety regulations and in toxicology is an advantage FDA related validation experience and LC MS/MS experience is an advantage What do we stand for? We are Pioneers, Partners and Performers: Your working place: world class laboratories with state-of-the-art equipment. As part of our ambitious scientific team you work together with the best on key topics of the global food chain. BIOMIN is constantly growing - since more than 35 years. This creates a lot of space for good ideas and opportunities for personal development and individual careers. Here are some more good reasons to work for us. What else do you need to know? Reference Number: 779 You will be based in Tulln (Austria) Your type of employment: 38.5 hours/week, full-time, temporary contract (12 months) This position is available immediately however, we are happy to consider your notice period or your desired start date. Based on your classification in our ERBER Group career model, your professional experience and your qualification, we offer you an attractive total compensation package starting at EUR 40.000 gross p.a. (full-time incl. fix and variable components) Are you ready to leave real 'foodprints' with us? We are looking forward to your online application. Do you have any questions? Please contact: Ms Marina NOLZ, +43 2782 803 Or visit our website: www.biomin.net

A1 ist viel mehr als nur ein Telekommunikationsunternehmen. Als Teil der A1 Telekom Austria Group treiben wir die Digitalisierung in 7 Ländern mit innovativen Lösungen und neuen Geschäftsfeldern voran. Du bist auf der Suche nach einem Praktikum und möchtest gemeinsam mit uns die Zukunft gestalten, in der du leben willst? Dann bring dich mit all deinen Stärken ein und probiere Neues aus. Entwickle dich mit uns weiter. Make it happen.

Auf den Punkt gebracht

Praktika bei A1 - eine Win-Win-Situation! Wir gewinnen mit dir eine tatkräftige Unterstützung und du hast die Gelegenheit 6 - 12 Monate (für mind. 30 Stunden) praktische Erfahrung zu sammeln und deine Fähigkeiten auszubauen. Wir freuen uns auf dich und deine Ideen!

Im Business Intelligence Competence Center stellen wir Advanced Analytics und state-of-the-art Reporting für unsere Fachbereiche bereit und führen neue Technologien, wie Data Lake & Artificial Intelligence Lösungen ein. Damit liefern wir entscheidende Informationen für die Erreichung unserer Unternehmensziele.

Du lernst gerne Neues, bist neugierig und motiviert? Dann bewirb dich jetzt und werde ab Jänner 2021 Teil unseres Teams!

Dein Praktikum

Du konzipierst, entwickelst und testest skalierbare Big Data Lösungen für A1. Neben klassischen Batch-Lösungen designst & konstruierst du auch 'near' real time Lösungen.

Du arbeitest eng mit den Data Scientisten und anderen Stakeholdern in den Fachbereichen zusammen.

Du arbeitest am Aufbau & der Architektur des zentralen Data Lake mit.

Du optimierst den Datenfluss, testest und beurteilst die Genauigkeit der Datenverarbeitung.

Du testest, vergleichst und erprobst neue Technologien und treibst so Innovationen voran.

Du bist bei uns richtig, weil ...

du ein Universitäts- oder Fachhochschulstudium mit Schwerpunkt Mathematik, Informatik oder Wirtschaftsinformatik absolvierst oder bereits abgeschlossen hast.

du Kenntnisse im Design & der Entwicklung von Data Pipelines, idealerweise (near-) real time Implementierungen mitbringst.

Englisch für dich kein Problem ist.

du dank deiner schnellen Auffassungsgabe Probleme rasch erfasst und effektiv löst.

du ab Mitte Jänner 2021 bei uns starten kannst.

Besonders freuen wir uns über deine Bewerbung, wenn ...

du Linux, Java, Scala & Python kennst und bereits Erfahrung im Einsatz von BIG DATA Distributionen (z.B. Cloudera) hast.

Deine Benefits @ A1

Flexible Arbeitszeitgestaltung von A1 Flexzeit bis Mobile Working

Best of both: Stabilität eines erfolgreichen Unternehmens mit innovativen Methoden

Eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten mit viel Gestaltungsfreiraum

Moderne Arbeitsatmosphäre und zentrales Office mit guter öffentlicher Anbindung

Constant Learning mit vielen Möglichkeiten & Angeboten

Bezahlte Mittagspause & Kantine, zusätzliche Urlaubstage und zahlreiche weitere Vergünstigungen

Wir bieten Dir die Chance, die Zukunft von Österreichs größtem Kommunikationsunternehmen aktiv mitzugestalten. Das kollektivvertragliche monatliche Mindestentgelt für dieses Praktikum beträgt EUR 2.288,62 brutto.

Wir bei A1 sind überzeugt, dass Frauen mit ihren Ideen und Arbeitsweisen unverzichtbar für unseren Unternehmenserfolg und unsere Kultur sind. Deshalb freuen wir uns besonders über Bewerbungen von Frauen und werden bei gleicher Qualifikation die Position mit einer Frau besetzen.

Job Description - Computational Biology Principal Scientist (m/f/d) (2010194)
Boehringer Ingelheim is an equal opportunity global employer who takes pride in maintaining a diverse and inclusive culture. We embrace diversity of perspectives and strive for an inclusive environment which benefits our employees, patients and communities.
Computational Biology Principal Scientist (m/f/d)-2010194
THE POSITION


Global Computational Biology and Digital Sciences (GCBDS) is a global organization across multiple sites at Boehringer Ingelheim: Vienna Austria, Biberach Germany and Ridgefield USA. With immediate effect, we are currently hiring a Computational Biology Principal Scientist in Vienna, Austria.

The computational biologist drives in-silico approaches for target discovery and validation primarily in the area of cancer research. Leveraging large public and proprietary multi-omics data sets in combination with functional read-outs (e.g., advanced CRISPR screens) enable the mining for novel therapeutic concepts. Access to some of the currently largest available patient cohorts augments the available data landscape. Team science is one of our core principles, so the successful applicant will work closely together with colleagues from both dry- and wet-labs.

Tasks & responsibilities
Actively guide experiment design and data production/acquisition efforts
Analyzing and combining large-scale human data sets using state-of-the-art methods, ultimately leading to new therapeutic concepts
Presentation of results to internal and external stakeholders as well as working with top-tier academic institutes and CROs
Publishing and presenting novel scientific results at international conferences and workshops is encouraged
Requirements
Ph.D. degree with post-doctoral experience in a relevant field
Excellent publication record
Proficiency in current state-of-the-art data science methods in the cancer domain
Profound knowledge of cancer biology
Proficiency with Linux environment, HPCs, cloud computing, and scripting languages
Your Benefits
Position specific training opportunities for your personal and professional growth
Comprehensive health promotion, sustaining your health in the best possible way
Additional off-days (bridge-days) for more leisure time
Company pension scheme, because your future matters
Staff restaurant with a variety of lunch options for your daily well-being
We offer an attractive salary package in line with your qualification, experience and individual competencies. The base pay is composed of a market oriented excess payment and the respective amount according to the Austrian collective agreement (at least € 60,000 gross per year/full-time).

WHY BOEHRINGER INGELHEIM?
Breakthrough therapies and innovative healthcare solutions for both humans and animals
As a family owned company, we take the long view and stand for stability and sustainability
Talented and ambitious teams, living innovation and growing together
50,000 employees globally, 2,600 in Vienna
Boehringer Ingelheim is an equal opportunity global employer who takes pride in maintaining a diverse and inclusive culture. We embrace diversity of perspectives and strive for an inclusive environment, which benefits our employees, patients and communities.

Want to learn more? Visit https://www.boehringer-ingelheim.at
EFFECTS OF COVID-19


We will continue to hire talented people and we look forward to receiving your applications. For applicants, virtual video interviews will initially take place. During the limited in-person interviews we still have during this time, we pay special attention to distance and the recommended hygiene rules. We warmly welcome new employees to our 3-day onboarding event, which takes place in the form of an online event.

READY TO CONTACT US?

As a member of the Nuclear Power Engineering Section(NPES), the Nuclear Power Data Analyst contributes to the development, maintenance and validation of the databases, manages web-applications, implements nuclear power plant production related projects and publishes technical documents in order to contribute to the IAEA's overall objective of fostering the exchange of information.

The Nuclear Power Data Analyst supports the ongoing development and recommends improvement of database structures and links between datasets; monitors and reports on the quality and maintains the update of the relevant websites linked to the databases. He/she develops analysis tools in order to enhance IAEA research, reporting and presentations that incorporate data.

Role

The Nuclear Power Data Analyst is: (1) a technical expert, working with NPES team to support and enhance the effectiveness of collaboration in nuclear engineering development amongst Agency staff and experts in Member States; to implement and maintain technical databases and applications; (2) a custodian and a supporter of several databases and applications, including Power Reactor Information System (PRIS) and Country Nuclear Power Profiles (CNPP) database; (3) a network collecting, reviewing and disseminating the information by establishing networks; (4) a developer of several databases and their web sites; and (5) a responsible scientific secretary for nuclear power engineering projects and documents.

Functions / Key Results Expected

Support PRIS database and, its services and production of related IAEA publications.
Maintain and disseminate information of the Country Nuclear Power Profiles.
Support and maintain other nuclear power operation related databases and applications.
Provide statistical analysis of data for IAEA research, publications, presentations and reports.
Plan and organize meetings and exchange of information prepare technical reports and other publications on engineering issues and databases.
Provide technical management and support for TC projects as Technical Officer, develop strategy/action plans to achieve project milestones, organize and participate in seminars, workshops, expert missions, training courses, meetings with Member State counterparts concerning project progress and implementation.
Carry out networking/information exchanges at the IAEA, with the Member States and international organizations.
Maintain close cooperation with national and international organization in the area of engineering and power reactor information.

Qualifications, Experience and Language skills

A first level university degree in engineering or related field.
At least five years of working experience in the field of nuclear energy, of which four years of experience with nuclear power data/web site development/maintenance.
Proven experience in nuclear power data management is required.
Experience with the creation and maintenance of databases, including data/information collection and dissemination is required.
Experience with data mining and statistical analysis, for example using SQL, programming XML, JavaScript, or ETL frameworks.
Experience in data visualization/presentation is required.

Excellent oral and written command of English. Knowledge of other official IAEA languages (Arabic, Chinese, French, Russian and Spanish) is an asset.

Remuneration

The IAEA offers an attractive remuneration package including a tax-free annual net base salary starting at US $60962 (subject to mandatory deductions for pension contributions and health insurance), a variable post adjustment which currently amounts to US $ 31578*, dependency benefits, rental subsidy, education grant, relocation and repatriation expenses; 6 weeks' annual vacation, home leave, pension plan and health insurance

job_title_orig: Postdoctoral Computational Biologist in Cancer Research (Christian Haslinger Group) (m/f/d) - 2 years (optional extension)
job_description:
Postdoctoral Computational Biologist in Cancer Research (Christian Haslinger Group) (m/f/d) - 2 years (optional extension)-208739

With immediate effect, we are seeking a highly motivated and creative computational biologist to join the group of Christian Haslinger as a PostDoc within the Global Computational Biology and Digital Sciences department at Boehringer Ingelheim RCV.

Your research will focus on functional genomics in the context of cancer research. More specifically, you will analyze state-of-the-art CRISPR screens (e.g. drug-anchored screens, dual guide screening designs, single-cell-based CRISPR screens) as part of an interdisciplinary environment. Your objective includes the discovery of genetic interactions in a complex disease background. Independent consultation and incorporation of large publically available data sets will be a vital aspect of your research. The final scope of your work is to deepen our current understanding of cancer genomics and to decipher potential targets for drug treatment. The advertised position is part of the global Boehringer Ingelheim Postdoc Program and we encourage applications from individuals with a strong interest in cancer research.

Duties & Responsibilities
Apply and implement state-of-the-art bioinformatics analysis and visualization methods
Transform multi-dimensional data into actionable biological insights
Pro-actively design data-driven analyses and propose follow-up strategies for hypothesis testing
Present your work to colleagues at Boehringer Ingelheim and at international conferences
Publish scientific results in peer-reviewed scientific journals
Requirements
PhD in bioinformatics or the life sciences with strong background in computational biology
Proficient knowledge of data analysis and visualization methods (R, Phyton)
Experience with state-of-the-art loss-of-function methods in cell lines is a plus
Evidence of scientific rigor and excellence as documented by peer-reviewed publications
Creative thinking, organized and self-motivated to innovate
Excellent communication, networking and presentation skills
About Boehringer Ingelheim’s Postdoc Programme
The initial appointment is for 2 years fixed term contract with potential for a 1-2 year extension
As a Postdoctoral Fellow you will benefit from a fully resourced and fully funded research environment with access to state-of-the-art tools, technologies and equipment
Embedded in the BI Discovery Research organization, you will benefit from vibrant and regular scientific exchange within BI’s post doc community, including global BI post doc retreats, and with research scientists as well as with academic collaboration partners
You will be expected to publish your scientific results in peer-reviewed journals and present your data at international conferences
At the end of the programme you will have the opportunity to compete for a transition grant to facilitate starting up your next lab

Your Benefits
Position specific training opportunities for your personal and professional growth
Comprehensive health promotion, sustaining your health in the best possible way
Additional off-days (bridge-days) for more leisure time
Staff restaurant with a variety of lunch options for your daily well-being

For this position we offer an interesting salary package considering your expertise and personal competencies as well as your professional experience. We are obliged by law to state the minimum salary according to the collective agreement, which amounts to € 46,525.22 gross per year (full-time) for this position, whereby an overpayment is possible.

Effects of COVID-19
We will continue to hire talented people and we look forward to receiving your applications. As a result of COVID-19, we have introduced alternative working arrangements to ensure that our employees can stay safe and healthy. At all company locations, we work remotely whenever possible. For applicants, virtual video interviews will initially take place. During the limited in-person interviews we still have during this time, we pay special attention to distance and the recommended hygiene rules. We warmly welcome new employees to our 3-day onboarding event, which takes place in the form of an online event.

Who we are
At Boehringer Ingelheim we create value through innovation with one clear goal: to improve the lives of patients. We develop breakthrough therapies and innovative healthcare solutions in areas of unmet medical need for both humans and animals. As a family owned company we focus on long term performance. We are powered by 50.000 employees globally who nurture a diverse, collaborative and inclusive culture. Learning and development for all employees is key, because your growth is our growth.
Want to learn more? Visit boehringer-ingelheim.com and join us in our effort to make more health.

job_description:
Laboratory Scientist Oncology Translation Science (m/f/d) - 2 years fixed-term contract-208742

With immediate effect, we are searching a highly motivated Lab Scientist with strong communication skills, who is an exceptional team-worker. This position will strengthen our multi-disciplinary research team focused on translational and biomarker-related aspects in drug development for cancer patients. It offers a unique possibility to work at the forefront of the development of novel targeted as well as immune-oncology based therapies.

Duties & Responsibilities
Independent planning, coordination, implementation, analysis and documentation of in vitro and ex vivo experiments
Characterization of biomarkers for novel therapeutic approaches, supporting the development of novel cancer drugs with molecular and cellular biology expertise
Analysis of signalling networks in cancer cell with a focus on novel approaches aimed towards clinical implementation
Experience in cancer immunology-related techniques is an advantage
Close collaboration with colleagues from various functions, eps. histopathology and cell based assays
Training/supervision of students
Requirements
Master’s degree in a relevant discipline (e.g. molecular biology, genetics, cancer immunology)
Experience with independently planning, performing and documenting in vitro and ex vivo experiments
Experience with cell culture, protein and RNA analysis
Strong scientific interest incl. literature search etc.
Willingness to assume responsibility in a matrix in a global department

job_title_orig: Postgraduate Research Associate (project employment) / Forest Scientist for adaptive forest...
job_description:
The Department of Forest- and Soil Sciences, Institute of Silviculture is currently seeking a Postgraduate Research Associate (project employment) for the research project FORSITE, who can help us with the development of silvicultural guidelines with information on appropriate choice of tree species and adaptation measure under climate change. The guidelines will provide recommendations for the future forest management based on a digital forest site classification.

The applicant should support the scientific research by conducting a literature review, analysis of forest ecological and silvicultural data, use of models and methods to design silvicultural measures and estimate tree species suitability. Projectmanagement experiences, good skills in scientific writing, layout and design is expected and very good knowledge of German language (writing and spelling) is a requirement. Knowledge and application of geographical information systems (analysis of vector and raster data, visualisation), ability to analyse large amounts of data, knowledge and application of statistical and analytical tools as well as creation and adaptation of scripts (JavaScript, R) is an advantage.

Gross monthly salary and pay grade in terms of collective agreement for university staff (payable 14 times per year): B1, € 2.929,00 (for 40 hours per week)

University of Natural Resources and Life Sciences Vienna seeks to increase the number of its female faculty and staff members. Therefore qualified women are strongly encouraged to apply. In case of equal qualification, female candidates will be given preference unless reasons specific to an individual male candidate tilt the balance in his favour.

Please send your job application to the Personnel department, University of Natural Resources and Life Sciences, 1190 Vienna, Peter-Jordan-Straße 70; E-Mail: kerstin.buchmueller@boku.ac.at. (Reference code: 172)

We regret that we cannot reimburse applicants travel and lodging expenses incurred as part of the selection and hiring process.

www.boku.ac.at
Additional Information
Additional comments

Please note that the full job description is only available in German.

Web site for additional job details

http://short.boku.ac.at/jobboerse

job_description:
Principal Scientist – Oncology PK/PD Modelling (m/f/d)-2010196

THE POSITION

As a family owned company with a long term commitment to improve human health we create Value through Innovation for our customers and are powered by our people. We are excited for the discovery of ground-breaking novel cancer treatments and believe that an organizational and individual desire for breakthrough discoveries is the key to identifying innovative First-in-Class medicine. To advance science we like to take ownership for decisions and actions, to make agile contributions with an open mind and come up with innovative ideas.

If you want join our breakthrough culture to build a successful career in mathematical and statistical modelling, and make a real difference to cancer patients and patient families worldwide, this is the right opportunity. The Discovery ADME Department within RCV is searching for a recognised expert to lead PK/PD modelling for oncology research in Vienna.

Tasks & responsibilities
Create value in discovery project teams by enabling decisions based on state-of-the art M&S approaches
Provide strategic leadership for the Department and with the colleagues globally in providing cutting edge M&S activities including impact on design of data acquisition, analytics, and reporting from pre-Lead Optimisation to clinical Proof of Concepts
Establish direction and objectives to maintain scientific leadership in data analysis and M&S approaches
Build strong expertise in predictive modelling relevant to PK/PD and pharmacometrics
Supervise other M&S scientists in the team
Foster organizational learning by linking into the internal network and translate Research knowledge to the clinics
Build and maintain external contacts and collaborations to enable access to the best talents and cutting-edge methodologies, and deliver to BI project work
Publish scientific work to contribute to global innovation
Requirements
University training in applied mathematics and statistics or PhD in modelling different biological systems, e.g. Systems Biology, Quantitative Systems Pharmacology, Pharmacometrics
At least 4 years of experience in a pharmaceutical setting with pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic modeling
Programming experience in languages like R, MATLAB, NONMEM, SAS, Python, Mathematica
Previous drug discovery and development working experience, ideally in areas of oncology or immunology
Strategic and connective thinking
Excellent team work and communication skills to drive cross-functional collaboration and team success with various disciplines
Inquisitive and curious of new data and ideas, and persistent testing them out to find clear new paths to success quickly
Excellent presentation skills (English as a working language, basic German an advantage)
Your Benefits
Position specific training opportunities for your personal and professional growth
Comprehensive health promotion, sustaining your health in the best possible way
Additional off-days (bridge-days) for more leisure time
Company pension scheme, because your future matters
Staff restaurant with a variety of lunch options for your daily well-being

We offer an attractive salary package in line with your qualification, experience and individual competencies. The base pay is composed of a market oriented excess payment and the respective amount according to the Austrian collective agreement (at least € 60,000 gross per year/full-time).

WHY BOEHRINGER INGELHEIM?

Breakthrough therapies and innovative healthcare solutions for both humans and animals

As a family owned company, we take the long view and stand for stability and sustainability

Talented and ambitious teams, living innovation and growing together

50,000 employees globally, 2,600 in Vienna

Boehringer Ingelheim is an equal opportunity global employer who takes pride in maintaining a diverse and inclusive culture. We embrace diversity of perspectives and strive for an inclusive environment, which benefits our employees, patients and communities.

Want to learn more? Visit https://www.boehringer-ingelheim.at

EFFECTS OF COVID-19

We will continue to hire talented people and we look forward to receiving your applications. For applicants, virtual video interviews will initially take place. During the limited in-person interviews we still have during this time, we pay special attention to distance and the recommended hygiene rules. We warmly welcome new employees to our 3-day onboarding event, which takes place in the form of an online event.

READY TO CONTACT US?

Your HR Recruiting Manager for this position is Doris Staribacher.
We are looking forward to receiving your application via our application portal so that we can treat your data confidentially and in compliance with the GDPR.
On our career site you will find many interesting facts about us as an employer as well as information about the application process or our diverse divisions. Take a look behind the scenes and get an insight into our day-to-day business.
If the position is not relevant for you, but might be interesting for someone you know, you can still forward it to friends or colleagues.

Job - Research & Development
Primary Location - Europe-AT-Vienna-Vienna
Organization - AT-Boehringer Ingelheim Regional Center Vienna GmbH & Co KG (Austria)
Schedule - Full-time

job_description: At BIOMIN we harness the power of science to support animal health and performance. By applying state-of-the-art and proprietary technology we deliver natural, sustainable and profitable solutions to the livestock industry. For over 35 years we have pioneered innovative solutions for mycotoxin risk management and gut performance. BIOMIN is part of ERBER Group. In the gut performance further development role, you will work in a highly motivated team dedicated to developing innovative and sustainable feed additive solutions for the improvement of gut health, well-being and optimum performance of poultry, pigs, ruminants and aquaculture. You will use your technical knowledge to coordinate state-of-the-art in vitro and in vivo experiments and investigate the efficacy and mode of action of probiotics, phytogenics and acidifiers. Close collaboration and knowledge exchange with other departments and experts will keep your workday full of variety. Are you up to the challenge? Scientist Further Development Gut Performance (m/f) These are the tasks we trust in you: Participation and scientific contribution to R&D projects in the field of feed additive product development Planning, coordination and documentation of animal feeding trials and laboratory experiments Data management and interpretation, statistical analysis and preparation of scientific trial reports, literature search, contribution to or writing of scientific publications Introduction and application of state of the art methods in specific research field Establishment and maintenance of collaborative networks and partnerships with relevant research organizations, active participation at scientific congresses To leave real 'foodprints' with us you need the following skills: Degree in Animal science Veterinary or natural sciences, PhD degree would be of advantage Experience in scientific / trial design, data analysis and writing reports is necessary Experience in 'Omic' technologies Project Management experience of advantage Strong ability to work in an intercultural team of professionals, structured thinking and able to generate innovative ideas Excellent knowledge of MS Office Excellent verbal & written communication skills in English What do we stand for? We are Pioneers, Partners and Performers! 100% of trust in you and your skills in advance Structured on-boarding program for a good start into your new job Room to maneuver and for your personal development Exciting and challenging tasks in an international environment Strong support from your own and other teams across our organization Internal and external development programs Unique company culture, on first name terms from trainee to CEO Have a look at our Sustainability Report to get to know us even better. Here are some more good reasons to work for us. What else do you need to know? Reference Number: 655 You will be based in Getzersdorf (Austria) Your type of employment: 38.5 hours/week, full-time, permanent contract This position is available immediately however, we are happy to consider your notice period or your desired start date. Based on your classification in our ERBER Group career model, your professional experience and your qualification, we offer you an attractive total compensation package starting at EUR 40 000 gross p.a. (full-time incl. fix and variable components) Are you ready to leave real 'foodprints' with us? We are looking forward to your online application. Do you have any questions? Please contact: Ms Marina NOLZ, +43 2782 803 Or visit our website: www.biomin.net For more details about our benefits click here.

Be part of our team!

AT&S is one of the globally leading manufacturers of high-end printed circuit boards and IC substrates and belongs to the global technology leaders. With more than 10.000 employees worldwide, plants in Austria, China, India, Korea, and Sales Support Offices around the globe. To facilitate our continuous global policy of expansion, we are constantly looking for young talents and experienced professionals with high commitment and ideas that make a difference. Engagement and flexibility are essential factors for our consequent policy of growth. To enhance our successful Quality Management Team at our Headquarters in Leoben (AT) we are seeking to fill the newly created position with an experienced candidate:

Data Analyst Junior (m/f/d)

In this role you are responsible for the support of strategic projects from the persepctive of Quality Management. Furthermore you take the lead in the conduction and implementation of statistical analysis methods and models as well as the creation of defined quality documents, which you successfully put into practice on the production floor.

Your responsibilities
Collection and preparation of unstructured data sets
Analysis of data by means of statistical programs
Creation of reports and dashboards for all areas of the Business Unit
Ongoing imrpovement of current analysis and establishment of new statistical methods
Presentation and interpretation of results
Your profile
Successfully completed technical eduation (such as Higher Technical College - HTL, University) or several years of professional experience in the field of data analysis
Basic knowledge in the area of statistics (statistical tests, capability analysis, SPC, etc.)
Advanced skills in MS Office (Excel, VBA-proficiency is beneficial)
User experience in at least one statistic tool (preferrably JMP)
Basic knowledge in dealing with a program language (VBA, SQL, Java, etc.)
First experience in Quality Management
Good command of English written and orally
Our offer
Exciting and diverse topics in an international technology company
A corporate culture, that enables personal and professional growth as well as contribution of ideas
A safe and lasting workplace in an internationally expanding environment
An appreciative and supportive team as well as flat hierarchies
Interesting professional development opportunities
If you are looking for a new challenging task please send us your application and your detailed resume. It´s just a click to apply online and we are looking forward to it. Your HR Team!

Our salary packages are competitive, take individual qualifications, and experience into consideration. In accordance with the Austrian collective labor agreement, we advise you that the minimum gross annual salary for this role is 36.000,- Euro.

Sind Sie ein technischer und kreativer Problemlöser? Begleiten Sie gerne Kunden durch einen gesamten Projektzyklus und suchen die bestmögliche technische und algorithmische Lösung? Arbeiten Sie gerne im Data Science Umfeld und haben Sie Interesse an der Wissensextraktion, Konstruktion und Verwertung von Sozialen Netzwerkdaten?
Wenn ja, bewerben Sie sich bei uns für eine Stelle im Bereich Social Computing!
Aufgabenstellung:

Sie werden aktiv an vielen spannenden Projekten und abwechslungsreichen Anwendungen beteiligt sein. Von Anfang an können Sie das Projekt und den Lösungspfad aktiv gestalten. Ihre Aufgabe wird es sein, Daten in verschiedenen Formen zu verstehen und zu analysieren. Sie entscheiden, wie mit den Daten umzugehen ist, wie sie verarbeitet werden und mit welchen Technologien Sie das Ziel gemeinsam mit unserem Partner erreichen.

Kundenkontakt und Begleitung der Kunden durch den gesamten Projektzyklus
Technische Analyse von Daten

Laufendes oder abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik, Softwareentwicklung, Telematik, Mathematik, Statistik oder ein vergleichbares naturwissenschaftliches/technisches Studium
Berufserfahrung in einen oder mehreren Bereichen der Softwareentwicklung, der Data Science, u.Ä. wünschenswert
Kenntnisse in Python und Java erforderlich
Kenntnisse in anderen Programmiersprachen und Analysewerkzeugen von Vorteil
Hohe Problemlösekompetenz und gute Kommunikationsfähigkeit
Teamfähigkeit und Selbständigkeit
Wir bieten:
Innovative, herausfordernde und vielfältige Kundenprojekte aus unterschiedlichen Industrie-Bereichen
Abwechslungsreiche Lösungsansätze und unterschiedlichste Projektverläufe
Zugang zu den neuesten Technologien

Dynamisches, kreatives und multi-kulturelles Team

Job Description - Principal Scientist – Oncology PK/PD Modelling (m/f/d) (2010196)
Boehringer Ingelheim is an equal opportunity global employer who takes pride in maintaining a diverse and inclusive culture. We embrace diversity of perspectives and strive for an inclusive environment which benefits our employees, patients and communities.
Principal Scientist – Oncology PK/PD Modelling (m/f/d)-2010196
THE POSITION


As a family owned company with a long term commitment to improve human health we create Value through Innovation for our customers and are powered by our people. We are excited for the discovery of ground-breaking novel cancer treatments and believe that an organizational and individual desire for breakthrough discoveries is the key to identifying innovative First-in-Class medicine. To advance science we like to take ownership for decisions and actions, to make agile contributions with an open mind and come up with innovative ideas.

If you want join our breakthrough culture to build a successful career in mathematical and statistical modelling, and make a real difference to cancer patients and patient families worldwide, this is the right opportunity. The Discovery ADME Department within RCV is searching for a recognised expert to lead PK/PD modelling for oncology research in Vienna.

Tasks & responsibilities
Create value in discovery project teams by enabling decisions based on state-of-the art M&S approaches
Provide strategic leadership for the Department and with the colleagues globally in providing cutting edge M&S activities including impact on design of data acquisition, analytics, and reporting from pre-Lead Optimisation to clinical Proof of Concepts
Establish direction and objectives to maintain scientific leadership in data analysis and M&S approaches
Build strong expertise in predictive modelling relevant to PK/PD and pharmacometrics
Supervise other M&S scientists in the team
Foster organizational learning by linking into the internal network and translate Research knowledge to the clinics
Build and maintain external contacts and collaborations to enable access to the best talents and cutting-edge methodologies, and deliver to BI project work
Publish scientific work to contribute to global innovation
Requirements
University training in applied mathematics and statistics or PhD in modelling different biological systems, e.g. Systems Biology, Quantitative Systems Pharmacology, Pharmacometrics
At least 4 years of experience in a pharmaceutical setting with pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic modeling
Programming experience in languages like R, MATLAB, NONMEM, SAS, Python, Mathematica
Previous drug discovery and development working experience, ideally in areas of oncology or immunology
Strategic and connective thinking
Excellent team work and communication skills to drive cross-functional collaboration and team success with various disciplines
Inquisitive and curious of new data and ideas, and persistent testing them out to find clear new paths to success quickly
Excellent presentation skills (English as a working language, basic German an advantage)
Your Benefits
Position specific training opportunities for your personal and professional growth
Comprehensive health promotion, sustaining your health in the best possible way
Additional off-days (bridge-days) for more leisure time
Company pension scheme, because your future matters
Staff restaurant with a variety of lunch options for your daily well-being
We offer an attractive salary package in line with your qualification, experience and individual competencies. The base pay is composed of a market oriented excess payment and the respective amount according to the Austrian collective agreement (at least € 60,000 gross per year/full-time).

WHY BOEHRINGER INGELHEIM?
Breakthrough therapies and innovative healthcare solutions for both humans and animals
As a family owned company, we take the long view and stand for stability and sustainability
Talented and ambitious teams, living innovation and growing together

Data is king when it comes to enabling business strategy and supporting decisions in a digital era. But there are at least 4 steps between data and decision support: understand what data is needed, source it, provision it and deliver it in an insightful and actionable way. At Red Bull we have created a Data team to seamlessly connect and operationalize these steps. Our unique asset, the Corporate Data Model, hubs all our data along the entire business value chain, from brand awareness to free cash flow. Since data increases its value with use, developing our Corporate Data Model is a constant fascinating adventure that keeps renewing every day. That is why we are looking for a new Business Data Analyst & Project Manager, a data savvy business person who supports cross-functional partners with understanding data needs, co-leads with IT data sourcing and provisioning up to the Corporate Data Model and lastly assists business teams to develop insights/support decisions.

DEVELOP INSIGHTFUL AND ACTIONABLE REPORTS
Assist business partners to think, design and create insightful and actionable reports. Lead as business project manager the development of cross-functional reports

Excellent analytical skills and passionate with data
