job_description:
Principal Scientist – Oncology PK/PD Modelling (m/f/d)-2010196

THE POSITION

As a family owned company with a long term commitment to improve human health we create Value through Innovation for our customers and are powered by our people. We are excited for the discovery of ground-breaking novel cancer treatments and believe that an organizational and individual desire for breakthrough discoveries is the key to identifying innovative First-in-Class medicine. To advance science we like to take ownership for decisions and actions, to make agile contributions with an open mind and come up with innovative ideas.

If you want join our breakthrough culture to build a successful career in mathematical and statistical modelling, and make a real difference to cancer patients and patient families worldwide, this is the right opportunity. The Discovery ADME Department within RCV is searching for a recognised expert to lead PK/PD modelling for oncology research in Vienna.

Tasks & responsibilities
Create value in discovery project teams by enabling decisions based on state-of-the art M&S approaches
Provide strategic leadership for the Department and with the colleagues globally in providing cutting edge M&S activities including impact on design of data acquisition, analytics, and reporting from pre-Lead Optimisation to clinical Proof of Concepts
Establish direction and objectives to maintain scientific leadership in data analysis and M&S approaches
Build strong expertise in predictive modelling relevant to PK/PD and pharmacometrics
Supervise other M&S scientists in the team
Foster organizational learning by linking into the internal network and translate Research knowledge to the clinics
Build and maintain external contacts and collaborations to enable access to the best talents and cutting-edge methodologies, and deliver to BI project work
Publish scientific work to contribute to global innovation
Requirements
University training in applied mathematics and statistics or PhD in modelling different biological systems, e.g. Systems Biology, Quantitative Systems Pharmacology, Pharmacometrics
At least 4 years of experience in a pharmaceutical setting with pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic modeling
Programming experience in languages like R, MATLAB, NONMEM, SAS, Python, Mathematica
Previous drug discovery and development working experience, ideally in areas of oncology or immunology
Strategic and connective thinking
Excellent team work and communication skills to drive cross-functional collaboration and team success with various disciplines
Inquisitive and curious of new data and ideas, and persistent testing them out to find clear new paths to success quickly
Excellent presentation skills (English as a working language, basic German an advantage)
Your Benefits
Position specific training opportunities for your personal and professional growth
Comprehensive health promotion, sustaining your health in the best possible way
Additional off-days (bridge-days) for more leisure time
Company pension scheme, because your future matters
Staff restaurant with a variety of lunch options for your daily well-being

We offer an attractive salary package in line with your qualification, experience and individual competencies. The base pay is composed of a market oriented excess payment and the respective amount according to the Austrian collective agreement (at least € 60,000 gross per year/full-time).

WHY BOEHRINGER INGELHEIM?

Breakthrough therapies and innovative healthcare solutions for both humans and animals

As a family owned company, we take the long view and stand for stability and sustainability

Talented and ambitious teams, living innovation and growing together

50,000 employees globally, 2,600 in Vienna

Boehringer Ingelheim is an equal opportunity global employer who takes pride in maintaining a diverse and inclusive culture. We embrace diversity of perspectives and strive for an inclusive environment, which benefits our employees, patients and communities.

Want to learn more? Visit https://www.boehringer-ingelheim.at

EFFECTS OF COVID-19

We will continue to hire talented people and we look forward to receiving your applications. For applicants, virtual video interviews will initially take place. During the limited in-person interviews we still have during this time, we pay special attention to distance and the recommended hygiene rules. We warmly welcome new employees to our 3-day onboarding event, which takes place in the form of an online event.

READY TO CONTACT US?

Your HR Recruiting Manager for this position is Doris Staribacher.
We are looking forward to receiving your application via our application portal so that we can treat your data confidentially and in compliance with the GDPR.
On our career site you will find many interesting facts about us as an employer as well as information about the application process or our diverse divisions. Take a look behind the scenes and get an insight into our day-to-day business.
If the position is not relevant for you, but might be interesting for someone you know, you can still forward it to friends or colleagues.

job_description:
Business Manager für Data Science - AI
Sind Sie auf der Suche nach einer herausfordernden Tätigkeit im Bereich Data Science? Schlagworte wie AI, NLP, Machine Learning lassen Ihr Herz höherschlagen? Möchten Sie gerne eine Schnittstelle zwischen der Wirtschaft und der Forschung sein und KundInnen hinsichtlich unserer Dienstleistungen und Produkte beraten und betreuen? Wenn ja, freuen wir uns, Sie kennen zu lernen!

job_description: At BIOMIN we harness the power of science to support animal health and performance. By applying state-of-the-art and proprietary technology we deliver natural, sustainable and profitable solutions to the livestock industry. For over 35 years we have pioneered innovative solutions for mycotoxin risk management and gut performance. BIOMIN is part of ERBER Group. In the gut performance further development role, you will work in a highly motivated team dedicated to developing innovative and sustainable feed additive solutions for the improvement of gut health, well-being and optimum performance of poultry, pigs, ruminants and aquaculture. You will use your technical knowledge to coordinate state-of-the-art in vitro and in vivo experiments and investigate the efficacy and mode of action of probiotics, phytogenics and acidifiers. Close collaboration and knowledge exchange with other departments and experts will keep your workday full of variety. Are you up to the challenge? Scientist Further Development Gut Performance (m/f) These are the tasks we trust in you: Participation and scientific contribution to R&D projects in the field of feed additive product development Planning, coordination and documentation of animal feeding trials and laboratory experiments Data management and interpretation, statistical analysis and preparation of scientific trial reports, literature search, contribution to or writing of scientific publications Introduction and application of state of the art methods in specific research field Establishment and maintenance of collaborative networks and partnerships with relevant research organizations, active participation at scientific congresses To leave real 'foodprints' with us you need the following skills: Degree in Animal science Veterinary or natural sciences, PhD degree would be of advantage Experience in scientific / trial design, data analysis and writing reports is necessary Experience in 'Omic' technologies Project Management experience of advantage Strong ability to work in an intercultural team of professionals, structured thinking and able to generate innovative ideas Excellent knowledge of MS Office Excellent verbal & written communication skills in English What do we stand for? We are Pioneers, Partners and Performers! 100% of trust in you and your skills in advance Structured on-boarding program for a good start into your new job Room to maneuver and for your personal development Exciting and challenging tasks in an international environment Strong support from your own and other teams across our organization Internal and external development programs Unique company culture, on first name terms from trainee to CEO Have a look at our Sustainability Report to get to know us even better. Here are some more good reasons to work for us. What else do you need to know? Based on your classification in our ERBER Group career model, your professional experience and your qualification, we offer you an attractive total compensation package starting at EUR 40 000 gross p.a. (full-time incl. fix and variable components) Are you ready to leave real 'foodprints' with us? We are looking forward to your online application. Do you have any questions? job_title_orig: Junior Technical Project Engineer – Schwerpunkt Data Science
job_description:
Junior Technical Project Engineer - Schwerpunkt Data Science
Sind Sie ein technischer und kreativer Problemlöser? Begleiten Sie gerne Kunden durch einen gesamten Projektzyklus und suchen die bestmögliche technische und algorithmische Lösung? Arbeiten Sie gerne im Data Science Umfeld und haben Sie Interesse an der Wissensextraktion, Konstruktion und Verwertung von Sozialen Netzwerkdaten?
Wenn ja, bewerben Sie sich bei uns für eine Stelle im Bereich Social Computing!
Aufgabenstellung:

Sie werden aktiv an vielen spannenden Projekten und abwechslungsreichen Anwendungen beteiligt sein. Von Anfang an können Sie das Projekt und den Lösungspfad aktiv gestalten. Ihre Aufgabe wird es sein, Daten in verschiedenen Formen zu verstehen und zu analysieren. Sie entscheiden, wie mit den Daten umzugehen ist, wie sie verarbeitet werden und mit welchen Technologien Sie das Ziel gemeinsam mit unserem Partner erreichen.

Es gibt viel Platz zum Spielen!

Technische Begleitung von Projekten im Bereich „Social Computing“
Kundenkontakt und Begleitung der Kunden durch den gesamten Projektzyklus
Technische Analyse von Daten
Aufzeigen von kreativen, technischen Lösungsmöglichkeiten und Algorithmen
Starke Zusammenarbeit mit unseren internen Researchern und Wissensaustausch
Beratung der Kunden hinsichtlich zukünftiger Zusammenarbeit und neuer Projektmöglichkeiten
Erforderliche Kenntnisse:
Laufendes oder abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik, Softwareentwicklung, Telematik, Mathematik, Statistik oder ein vergleichbares naturwissenschaftliches/technisches Studium
Berufserfahrung in einen oder mehreren Bereichen der Softwareentwicklung, der Data Science, u.Ä. wünschenswert
Kenntnisse in Python und Java erforderlich
Kenntnisse in anderen Programmiersprachen und Analysewerkzeugen von Vorteil
Hohe Problemlösekompetenz und gute Kommunikationsfähigkeit
Teamfähigkeit und Selbständigkeit
Wir bieten:
Innovative, herausfordernde und vielfältige Kundenprojekte aus unterschiedlichen Industrie-Bereichen
Abwechslungsreiche Lösungsansätze und unterschiedlichste Projektverläufe
Zugang zu den neuesten Technologien
Hervorragende Work-Life-Balance (flexibler Arbeitsplan)
Dynamisches, kreatives und multi-kulturelles Team

Das kollektivvertragliche Einstiegsgehalt (ohne Berufserfahrung) für diese Vollzeitposition (38.5 h/W) liegt bei 2.461,- Euro brutto pro Monat (14-mal jährlich) zzgl. einer leistungsabhängigen Prämie. Die Möglichkeit einer Überzahlung in Abhängigkeit von Qualifikation und Erfahrung ist vorhanden.

Job Description - Principal Scientist – Oncology PK/PD Modelling (m/f/d) (2010196)
Boehringer Ingelheim is an equal opportunity global employer who takes pride in maintaining a diverse and inclusive culture. We embrace diversity of perspectives and strive for an inclusive environment which benefits our employees, patients and communities.
Principal Scientist – Oncology PK/PD Modelling (m/f/d)-2010196
THE POSITION


As a family owned company with a long term commitment to improve human health we create Value through Innovation for our customers and are powered by our people. We are excited for the discovery of ground-breaking novel cancer treatments and believe that an organizational and individual desire for breakthrough discoveries is the key to identifying innovative First-in-Class medicine. To advance science we like to take ownership for decisions and actions, to make agile contributions with an open mind and come up with innovative ideas.

If you want join our breakthrough culture to build a successful career in mathematical and statistical modelling, and make a real difference to cancer patients and patient families worldwide, this is the right opportunity. The Discovery ADME Department within RCV is searching for a recognised expert to lead PK/PD modelling for oncology research in Vienna.

Tasks & responsibilities
Create value in discovery project teams by enabling decisions based on state-of-the art M&S approaches
Provide strategic leadership for the Department and with the colleagues globally in providing cutting edge M&S activities including impact on design of data acquisition, analytics, and reporting from pre-Lead Optimisation to clinical Proof of Concepts
Establish direction and objectives to maintain scientific leadership in data analysis and M&S approaches
Build strong expertise in predictive modelling relevant to PK/PD and pharmacometrics
Supervise other M&S scientists in the team
Foster organizational learning by linking into the internal network and translate Research knowledge to the clinics
Build and maintain external contacts and collaborations to enable access to the best talents and cutting-edge methodologies, and deliver to BI project work
Publish scientific work to contribute to global innovation
Requirements
University training in applied mathematics and statistics or PhD in modelling different biological systems, e.g. Systems Biology, Quantitative Systems Pharmacology, Pharmacometrics
At least 4 years of experience in a pharmaceutical setting with pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic modeling
Programming experience in languages like R, MATLAB, NONMEM, SAS, Python, Mathematica
Previous drug discovery and development working experience, ideally in areas of oncology or immunology
Strategic and connective thinking
Excellent team work and communication skills to drive cross-functional collaboration and team success with various disciplines
Inquisitive and curious of new data and ideas, and persistent testing them out to find clear new paths to success quickly
Excellent presentation skills (English as a working language, basic German an advantage)
Your Benefits
Position specific training opportunities for your personal and professional growth
Comprehensive health promotion, sustaining your health in the best possible way
Additional off-days (bridge-days) for more leisure time
Company pension scheme, because your future matters
Staff restaurant with a variety of lunch options for your daily well-being
We offer an attractive salary package in line with your qualification, experience and individual competencies. The base pay is composed of a market oriented excess payment and the respective amount according to the Austrian collective agreement (at least € 60,000 gross per year/full-time).

WHY BOEHRINGER INGELHEIM?
Breakthrough therapies and innovative healthcare solutions for both humans and animals
As a family owned company, we take the long view and stand for stability and sustainability
Talented and ambitious teams, living innovation and growing together
50,000 employees globally, 2,600 in Vienna
Boehringer Ingelheim is an equal opportunity global employer who takes pride in maintaining a diverse and inclusive culture. We embrace diversity of perspectives and strive for an inclusive environment, which benefits our employees, patients and communities.

Want to learn more? Visit https://www.boehringer-ingelheim.at
EFFECTS OF COVID-19


We will continue to hire talented people and we look forward to receiving your applications. For applicants, virtual video interviews will initially take place. During the limited in-person interviews we still have during this time, we pay special attention to distance and the recommended hygiene rules. We warmly welcome new employees to our 3-day onboarding event, which takes place in the form of an online event.

READY TO CONTACT US?


Your HR Recruiting Manager for this position is Doris Staribacher.
We are looking forward to receiving your application via our application portal so that we can treat your data confidentially and in compliance with the GDPR.
On our career site you will find many interesting facts about us as an employer as well as information about the application process or our diverse divisions. Take a look behind the scenes and get an insight into our day-to-day business.
If the position is not relevant for you, but might be interesting for someone you know, you can still forward it to friends or colleagues.

- Research & Development

- AT-Boehringer Ingelheim Regional Center Vienna GmbH & Co KG (Austria)

Data Analyst (Quality)


Responsibilities
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
Filter and "clean" data by reviewing computer reports. printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems for QM department.

Acquiring data from primary or secondary data sources and maintaining databases

Interpreting data, analyzing results using statistical techniques

Proven working experience as data analyst or business data analyst

Drop in!* All the great people here at waterdrop (www.waterdrop.com) have been shaking up the market with our innovative microdrinks that help people to drink more water in a fun, healthy and more sustainable way. We’re proud of the fact we save a ton on plastic bottles, carbon emissions and sugar content. Following our rapid growth to well over 500K satisfied customers, including 18 stores, many loyal corporate customers and listed in over 3,500 retail markets, we are now conquering Europe! We need YOU to join us to conquer more markets! We need a detail-orinented and passionate Data Engineer/Cloud Developer (m/f/d)
If you want to be part of our success story, then drop in! We are a highly dynamic and international team who always have a good reason to drink (!).

Business Data Analyst & Project Manager
Fuschl am See

Data is king when it comes to enabling business strategy and supporting decisions in a digital era. But there are at least 4 steps between data and decision support: understand what data is needed, source it, provision it and deliver it in an insightful and actionable way. At Red Bull we have created a Data team to seamlessly connect and operationalize these steps. Our unique asset, the Corporate Data Model, hubs all our data along the entire business value chain, from brand awareness to free cash flow. Since data increases its value with use, developing our Corporate Data Model is a constant fascinating adventure that keeps renewing every day. That is why we are looking for a new Business Data Analyst & Project Manager, a data savvy business person who supports cross-functional partners with understanding data needs, co-leads with IT data sourcing and provisioning up to the Corporate Data Model and lastly assists business teams to develop insights/support decisions.
UNDERSTAND BUSINESS AND DATA
Partner with business teams to figure out and develop new use cases for cross-functional reports. Identify data requirements in terms of business fit, availability, quality, consistency and frequency
DESIGN DATA SOURCING, MODELLING AND PROVISIONING
Think and conceptually design the integration of cross functionally relevant third party data; validate from business perspective the technical implementation realized by IT
OWN AND DEVELOP THE CORPORATE DATA MODEL FRAMEWORK
Review and approve all data integration projects to the Corporate Data Model initiated by business functions in order to ensure consistency and transparency; devise and drive the development of solutions to improve the usability of the Corporate Data Model
DEVELOP INSIGHTFUL AND ACTIONABLE REPORTS
Assist business partners to think, design and create insightful and actionable reports. Lead as business project manager the development of cross-functional reports
EXPERIENCE
Your areas of knowledge and expertise

that matter most for this role:

Professional experience in a business analyst or consulting project manager position
Excellent analytical skills and passionate with data
Hands-on experience with data models, data preparation and reporting solutions (ideally SAP BI, SQL/R/Phyton, SAP Analytics Cloud/Tableau/Power BI)
Strong communication and presentation skills
Enthusiastic learner, exceptionally curious, proactive, self-motivated and directed, team player
Responsible and able to work with different projects in parallel in a fast-paced environment
University degree or equivalent, ideally Economics, Business Administration, Computer Science or Statistics
University degree or equivalent, ideally Economics, Business Administration, Computer Science or Statistics
Very good English skills, German is a plus

job_title_orig: Laboratory Scientist Oncology Translation Science (m/f/d) - 2 years fixed-term contract
job_description:
Job Description - Laboratory Scientist Oncology Translation Science (m/f/d) - 2 years fixed-term contract (208742)
Boehringer Ingelheim is an equal opportunity global employer who takes pride in maintaining a diverse and inclusive culture. We embrace diversity of perspectives and strive for an inclusive environment which benefits our employees, patients and communities.
Laboratory Scientist Oncology Translation Science (m/f/d) - 2 years fixed-term contract-208742
With immediate effect, we are searching a highly motivated Lab Scientist with strong communication skills, who is an exceptional team-worker. This position will strengthen our multi-disciplinary research team focused on translational and biomarker-related aspects in drug development for cancer patients. It offers a unique possibility to work at the forefront of the development of novel targeted as well as immune-oncology based therapies.

Duties & Responsibilities
Independent planning, coordination, implementation, analysis and documentation of in vitro and ex vivo experiments
Characterization of biomarkers for novel therapeutic approaches, supporting the development of novel cancer drugs with molecular and cellular biology expertise
Analysis of signalling networks in cancer cell with a focus on novel approaches aimed towards clinical implementation
Experience in cancer immunology-related techniques is an advantage
Close collaboration with colleagues from various functions, eps. histopathology and cell based assays
Training/supervision of students
Requirements
Master’s degree in a relevant discipline (e.g. molecular biology, genetics, cancer immunology)
Experience with independently planning, performing and documenting in vitro and ex vivo experiments
Experience with cell culture, protein and RNA analysis
Strong scientific interest incl. literature search etc.
Willingness to assume responsibility in a matrix in a global department
Your Benefits
Position specific training opportunities for your personal and professional growth
Comprehensive health promotion, sustaining your health in the best possible way
Additional off-days (bridge-days) for more leisure time
Staff restaurant with a variety of lunch options for your daily well-being

For this position we offer an interesting salary package considering your expertise and personal competencies as well as your professional experience. We are obliged by law to state the minimum salary according to the collective agreement, which amounts to € 37,016.14 gross per year (full-time) for this position, whereby an overpayment is possible.

Effects of COVID-19
We will continue to hire talented people and we look forward to receiving your applications. For applicants, virtual video interviews will initially take place. During the limited in-person interviews we still have during this time, we pay special attention to distance and the recommended hygiene rules. job_title_orig: Senior Scientist (m/f/d) for Urban Climate Simulation and Impact Assessment
job_description:
We are Austria’s largest research and technology organisation and an international player in applied research for innovative infrastructure solutions. This makes us a powerful development partner for industry and a top employer in the scientific community. Our Center for Energy is seeking to hire new Ingenious Partners for our location in Vienna:
Senior Scientist (m/f/d) for Urban Climate Simulation and Impact Assessment
Digital Resilient Cities
You will be part of a multidisciplinary team focusing on the development of new approaches and solutions for climate-responsive cities around the world.
You will be pioneering new ways how cities can combat climate change with novel methods.
You lead a group of experts and closely work with our team of urban planners, data scientists, environmental experts as well as water and energy specialists.
You design, acquire and lead national/European research as well as client projects.
You push the boundaries of cutting-edge regional, urban and microclimate simulation by co-developing and improving climate models.
You extract regional climate simulation results as forcing data for our model runs to perform impact analysis and assessments for various urban scales.
You explore and interpret climate change signals not only as time series but as spatial patterns, comparing historical data with future climate scenarios.
You develop climate adaptation and resilience strategies for regional and urban scales applying climate models tailored to the local needs.
You motivate, lead and develop an interdisciplinary team of researchers and supervise PhDs.
You become a known player in the Austrian and European urban climate research community.
You publish the findings from research projects in top peer-reviewed journals and present research result at international conferences.
Your qualifications as an Ingenious Partner*:
PhD in Meteorology, applied physics or related disciplines
Several years of proven experience in regional, urban and microclimate simulations and climate models for different scales (e.g. WARF, Cosmo CLM and Palm4you, Solweig, Envimet, Grasshopper tools)
Profound knowledge in the assessment of climate models and the exploration of simulation results
Experience in analysing extreme events and climate hazards through spatial impact and risk assessment
Proven experience in developing and managing complex research projects and proven competence in leading and developing teams in a research environment
Proven track of scientific publications and experience in conducting workshops and scientific talks
Very good communication and presentation skills in German and English

What to expect:
The minimum gross annual salary according to the collective agreement is EUR 61.320,-.The actual salary will be determined individually, based on your qualifications and experience. In addition, we offer company benefits, flexible working conditions, individual training and career opportunities.

At AIT, the promotion of women is important to us - that's why we are especially looking forward to hearing from female applicants!

Please submit your application documents including CV, motivational letter and certificates online.

Synchronizing Healthcare
Werden Sie jetzt ein Teil davon!

Daten sammeln ist das eine. Wissen, was man mit ihnen tut, das andere. Anstatt auf eine Glaskugel zu vertrauen, bauen Sie für Ihre KundInnen die optimale SAP Analytics-Lösung. Aus einer Datenflut werden strukturierte, wettbewerbsrelevante Informationen, die strategische Entscheidungen für Ihre KundInnen leichter machen.

Ihre Aufgaben umfassen:
Sie blicken tief in die Systemarchitekturen, Prozesse und Anforderungen Ihrer KundInnen

Sie designen und entwickeln den nötigen Unternehmenssteuerungsprozess – strategisch und operativ

All das machen Sie remote und teilweise bei KundInnen vor Ort. Auf Reisen sind Sie bis zu 50% Ihrer Arbeitszeit.

Das bringen Sie mit:

Sie steigern die Performance Ihrer KundInnen durch Modellieren von BW oder HANA,
Sie sind fit in ABAP oder SQL
Sie können Lumira, Analysis Office und SAP Analytics Cloud bedienen
Sie erfassen Zusammenhänge und betriebswirtschaftliche Prozesse rasch und können sie gut analysieren
Sie sprechen und schreiben Deutsch und Englisch.
Im Optimalfall können Sie mit BW-IP oder BPC Planungslösungen gestalten, haben Erfahrung mit den Modulen FI/CO oder MM/SD und haben Erfahrung in Projekt- und Prozessmanagement.
Das bringen wir mit:

Teamorientierte und offene, sehr gute Unternehmenskultur sowie angenehmes Betriebsklima

Expandierendes und erfolgreiches Unternehmen

Kundenorientierung
„Die Herausforderungen, denen wir uns in den Projekten als SAP Analytics Team bei Phoron jeden Tag stellen, sind vielfältig und technisch wie inhaltlich sehr spannend. Durch die permanente Unterstützung in motivierten Teams macht es Spaß, kreative Lösungen zu finden und die Erfahrung weiterzutragen.“
Thomas, Unit Manager Analytics

Sie steigen bei uns in ein Team von Experten-KollegInnen ein. Unsere positive Geschäftsentwicklung, erfolgreiche Projektergebnisse und zufriedene KundInnen sind das eine, unser lernoffenes, amikales Klima das andere.
Entwicklungsperspektiven, Schulungen, Zusatzleistungen, monatliche MA-Events, sportliche und soziale Aktivitäten... Machen Sie sich am besten selbst ein Bild.

Wir freuen uns, wenn Sie ins Team kommen und bieten Ihnen für diese Position ein Bruttojahresgehalt inkl. leistungsabhängiger Prämie ab € 60.000,-. Sie können mehr? Wir sehen uns Ihre berufliche Qualifikation und Erfahrung an. Abhängig davon ist eine marktkonforme Überzahlung möglich.

Sie haben Spaß an neuen beruflichen Herausforderungen, möchten Ihre Karriere bei uns starten und mit den besten Köpfen und einem exzellenten Team zusammenarbeiten? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre aussagekräftige Bewerbung inkl. Lebenslauf mit Foto, Gehaltswunsch und frühestmöglichem Eintrittsdatum.

Organizational Setting

The objective of the Department of Nuclear Energy (NE) is to foster the efficient and safe use of nuclear power by supporting interested Member States in: improving the performance of nuclear power plants, the nuclear fuel cycle, and the management of nuclear wastes; catalysing innovation in nuclear power and fuel cycle technologies; developing indigenous capabilities around the world for national energy planning; deploying new nuclear power plants; preserving and disseminating nuclear information and knowledge; and advancing science and industry through improved operation of research reactors.

The department has a dynamic, participative and interactive operating environment with inputs received from the Board of Governors, the General Conference, policy and decision-makers, and technical counterparts in Member States and the international development community.

The Division of Nuclear Power comprises the Nuclear Power Engineering Section, the Nuclear Power Technology Development Section, the Nuclear Infrastructure Development Section and the INPRO (International Project on Innovative Nuclear Reactors and Fuel Cycles) Section. The Division provides core engineering, technological, human resource development and management support to interested Member States in the field of nuclear power.

The Nuclear Power Engineering Section (NPES) assists interested Member States in the development of the safe and effective operation of nuclear power plants and in the expansion of existing nuclear programmes. It provides guidance and encourages information exchange on engineering aspects of design, construction, commissioning, operations, maintenance, decommissioning; management and management systems; human resource development and performance improvement; expansion planning and strategies; and stakeholder involvement.

Main Purpose

As a member of the Nuclear Power Engineering Section(NPES), the Nuclear Power Data Analyst contributes to the development, maintenance and validation of the databases, manages web-applications, implements nuclear power plant production related projects and publishes technical documents in order to contribute to the IAEA's overall objective of fostering the exchange of information.

The Nuclear Power Data Analyst supports the ongoing development and recommends improvement of database structures and links between datasets; monitors and reports on the quality and maintains the update of the relevant websites linked to the databases. He/she develops analysis tools in order to enhance IAEA research, reporting and presentations that incorporate data.

Role

The Nuclear Power Data Analyst is: (1) a technical expert, working with NPES team to support and enhance the effectiveness of collaboration in nuclear engineering development amongst Agency staff and experts in Member States; to implement and maintain technical databases and applications; (2) a custodian and a supporter of several databases and applications, including Power Reactor Information System (PRIS) and Country Nuclear Power Profiles (CNPP) database; (3) a network collecting, reviewing and disseminating the information by establishing networks; (4) a developer of several databases and their web sites; and (5) a responsible scientific secretary for nuclear power engineering projects and documents.

Functions / Key Results Expected
Support PRIS database and, its services and production of related IAEA publications.
Maintain and disseminate information of the Country Nuclear Power Profiles.
Support and maintain other nuclear power operation related databases and applications.
Provide statistical analysis of data for IAEA research, publications, presentations and reports.
Plan and organize meetings and exchange of information prepare technical reports and other publications on engineering issues and databases.
Provide technical management and support for TC projects as Technical Officer, develop strategy/action plans to achieve project milestones, organize and participate in seminars, workshops, expert missions, training courses, meetings with Member State counterparts concerning project progress and implementation.
Carry out networking/information exchanges at the IAEA, with the Member States and international organizations.
Maintain close cooperation with national and international organization in the area of engineering and power reactor information.

Experience in data visualization/presentation is required.
Excellent oral and written command of English. Knowledge of other official IAEA languages (Arabic, Chinese, French, Russian and Spanish) is an asset.
Remuneration

job_title_orig: Postdoctoral Computational Biologist in Cancer Research (Christian Haslinger Group) (m/f/d) - 2 years (optional extension)
job_description:
Job Description - Postdoctoral Computational Biologist in Cancer Research (Christian Haslinger Group) (m/f/d) - 2 years (optional extension) (208739)
Boehringer Ingelheim is an equal opportunity global employer who takes pride in maintaining a diverse and inclusive culture. We embrace diversity of perspectives and strive for an inclusive environment which benefits our employees, patients and communities.
Postdoctoral Computational Biologist in Cancer Research (Christian Haslinger Group) (m/f/d) - 2 years (optional extension)-208739
With immediate effect, we are seeking a highly motivated and creative computational biologist to join the group of Christian Haslinger as a PostDoc within the Global Computational Biology and Digital Sciences department at Boehringer Ingelheim RCV.

Your research will focus on functional genomics in the context of cancer research. More specifically, you will analyze state-of-the-art CRISPR screens (e.g. drug-anchored screens, dual guide screening designs, single-cell-based CRISPR screens) as part of an interdisciplinary environment. Your objective includes the discovery of genetic interactions in a complex disease background. Independent consultation and incorporation of large publically available data sets will be a vital aspect of your research. The final scope of your work is to deepen our current understanding of cancer genomics and to decipher potential targets for drug treatment. The advertised position is part of the global Boehringer Ingelheim Postdoc Program and we encourage applications from individuals with a strong interest in cancer research.

Duties & Responsibilities
Apply and implement state-of-the-art bioinformatics analysis and visualization methods
Transform multi-dimensional data into actionable biological insights
Pro-actively design data-driven analyses and propose follow-up strategies for hypothesis testing
Present your work to colleagues at Boehringer Ingelheim and at international conferences
Publish scientific results in peer-reviewed scientific journals
Requirements
PhD in bioinformatics or the life sciences with strong background in computational biology
Proficient knowledge of data analysis and visualization methods (R, Phyton)
Experience with state-of-the-art loss-of-function methods in cell lines is a plus
Evidence of scientific rigor and excellence as documented by peer-reviewed publications
Creative thinking, organized and self-motivated to innovate
Excellent communication, networking and presentation skills
About Boehringer Ingelheim’s Postdoc Programme
The initial appointment is for 2 years fixed term contract with potential for a 1-2 year extension
As a Postdoctoral Fellow you will benefit from a fully resourced and fully funded research environment with access to state-of-the-art tools, technologies and equipment
Embedded in the BI Discovery Research organization, you will benefit from vibrant and regular scientific exchange within BI’s post doc community, including global BI post doc retreats, and with research scientists as well as with academic collaboration partners
You will be expected to publish your scientific results in peer-reviewed journals and present your data at international conferences
At the end of the programme you will have the opportunity to compete for a transition grant to facilitate starting up your next lab

Your Benefits
Position specific training opportunities for your personal and professional growth
Comprehensive health promotion, sustaining your health in the best possible way
Additional off-days (bridge-days) for more leisure time
Staff restaurant with a variety of lunch options for your daily well-being

For this position we offer an interesting salary package considering your expertise and personal competencies as well as your professional experience. We are obliged by law to state the minimum salary according to the collective agreement, which amounts to € 46,525.22 gross per year (full-time) for this position, whereby an overpayment is possible.

Effects of COVID-19
We will continue to hire talented people and we look forward to receiving your applications. As a result of COVID-19, we have introduced alternative working arrangements to ensure that our employees can stay safe and healthy. At all company locations, we work remotely whenever possible. For applicants, virtual video interviews will initially take place. During the limited in-person interviews we still have during this time, we pay special attention to distance and the recommended hygiene rules. We warmly welcome new employees to our 3-day onboarding event, which takes place in the form of an online event.
Who we are
At Boehringer Ingelheim we create value through innovation with one clear goal: to improve the lives of patients. We develop breakthrough therapies and innovative healthcare solutions in areas of unmet medical need for both humans and animals. As a family owned company we focus on long term performance. We are powered by 50.000 employees globally who nurture a diverse, collaborative and inclusive culture. Learning and development for all employees is key, because your growth is our growth.
Want to learn more? Visit boehringer-ingelheim.com and join us in our effort to make more health.

Contact
Your HR Recruiting Manager for this position is Doris Staribacher.

We are looking forward to receiving your application via our application portal so that we can treat your data confidentially and in compliance with the GDPR.

On our career site you will find many interesting facts about us as an employer as well as information about the application process or our diverse divisions. Take a look behind the scenes and get an insight into our day-to-day business.

If the position is not relevant for you, but might be interesting for someone you know, you can still forward it to friends or colleagues.

Sie haben bereits praktische Erfahrungen mit den SAP Analytics Tools als Anwender/in oder als Consultant aufgebaut und wollen dieses Wissen in Zukunft gemeinsam mit einem starken Team zum Mittelpunkt Ihrer Aktivitäten ausbauen.
Moderne Technologien sind Ihre Leidenschaft und Sie wollen damit aus den Daten unserer Kunden neu Erkenntnisse und Visualisierungen generieren.

Wir suchen eine/n technologie-affine/n Kollegin/en, der/die gut mit großen Datenmengen in Datenbanken umgehen kann und auch Erfahrungen mit SQL und höheren Programmiersprachen hat.

Mit der Spezialisierung auf Business Intelligence und BigData Analytics setzen Sie auf den Zukunftsmarkt - denn Daten sind das Gold des 21. Jahrhunderts.

Ihre Aufgaben umfassen:
Sie übernehmen Anforderungen aus Kundenprojekten, analysieren diese und setzen passende Lösungen um.
Dabei analysieren Sie BigData Quellen auf Strukturen und Anomalien.
Sie konzeptionieren und implementieren Datenmodelle auf SAP BW und SAP HANA,
Sie erstellen Queries, Berichte und Dashboards mit modernen Analyse und Visualisierungstools
Sie behalten immer das Ziel, die optimale Lösung zum Laufen zu bringen im Auge.
All das machen Sie remote. Teilweise sind Sie bei KundInnen vor Ort. Auf Reisen sind Sie etwa 50% Ihrer Arbeitszeit.

Das bringen Sie schon mit:
Sie haben eine technische Ausbildung auf Matura- oder Hochschulniveau abgeschlossen.
Sie beherrschen zumindest eine objektorientierte Programmiersprache
(idealerweise ABAP)

job_title_orig: Laboratory Scientist Oncology Translation Science (m/f/d) - 2 years fixed-term contract
job_description:
Laboratory Scientist Oncology Translation Science (m/f/d) - 2 years fixed-term contract-208742

With immediate effect, we are searching a highly motivated Lab Scientist with strong communication skills, who is an exceptional team-worker. This position will strengthen our multi-disciplinary research team focused on translational and biomarker-related aspects in drug development for cancer patients. It offers a unique possibility to work at the forefront of the development of novel targeted as well as immune-oncology based therapies.

Duties & Responsibilities
Independent planning, coordination, implementation, analysis and documentation of in vitro and ex vivo experiments
Characterization of biomarkers for novel therapeutic approaches, supporting the development of novel cancer drugs with molecular and cellular biology expertise
Analysis of signalling networks in cancer cell with a focus on novel approaches aimed towards clinical implementation
Experience in cancer immunology-related techniques is an advantage
Close collaboration with colleagues from various functions, eps. histopathology and cell based assays
Training/supervision of students
Requirements
Master’s degree in a relevant discipline (e.g. molecular biology, genetics, cancer immunology)
Experience with independently planning, performing and documenting in vitro and ex vivo experiments
Experience with cell culture, protein and RNA analysis
Strong scientific interest incl. literature search etc.
Willingness to assume responsibility in a matrix in a global department
Your Benefits
Position specific training opportunities for your personal and professional growth
Comprehensive health promotion, sustaining your health in the best possible way
Additional off-days (bridge-days) for more leisure time
Staff restaurant with a variety of lunch options for your daily well-being

For this position we offer an interesting salary package considering your expertise and personal competencies as well as your professional experience. We are obliged by law to state the minimum salary according to the collective agreement, which amounts to € 37,016.14 gross per year (full-time) for this position, whereby an overpayment is possible.

Effects of COVID-19
We will continue to hire talented people and we look forward to receiving your applications. As a result of COVID-19, we have introduced alternative working arrangements to ensure that our employees can stay safe and healthy. At all company locations, we work remotely whenever possible. For applicants, virtual video interviews will initially take place. During the limited in-person interviews we still have during this time, we pay special attention to distance and the recommended hygiene rules. We warmly welcome new employees to our 3-day onboarding event, which takes place in the form of an online event.

Who we are
At Boehringer Ingelheim we create value through innovation with one clear goal: to improve the lives of patients. We develop breakthrough therapies and innovative healthcare solutions in areas of unmet medical need for both humans and animals. As a family owned company we focus on long term performance. We are powered by 50.000 employees globally who nurture a diverse, collaborative and inclusive culture. Learning and development for all employees is key, because your growth is our growth.
Want to learn more? Visit boehringer-ingelheim.com and join us in our effort to make more health.

Contact
Your HR Recruiting Manager for this position is Doris Staribacher.

We are looking forward to receiving your application via our application portal so that we can treat your data confidentially and in compliance with the GDPR.

On our career site you will find many interesting facts about us as an employer as well as information about the application process or our diverse divisions. Take a look behind the scenes and get an insight into our day-to-day business.

If the position is not relevant for you, but might be interesting for someone you know, you can still forward it to friends or colleagues.

Happy mind in a happy body! Gesundheit geht vor, immer! Wir bieten jährliche Impfaktionen, MitarbeiterInnen-Pensionskasse, Betriebsärztin etc.

job_title_orig: Postgraduate Research Associate (project employment) / Forest Scientist for adaptive forest...
job_description:
The Department of Forest- and Soil Sciences, Institute of Silviculture is currently seeking a Postgraduate Research Associate (project employment) for the research project FORSITE, who can help us with the development of silvicultural guidelines with information on appropriate choice of tree species and adaptation measure under climate change. The guidelines will provide recommendations for the future forest management based on a digital forest site classification.

The applicant should support the scientific research by conducting a literature review, analysis of forest ecological and silvicultural data, use of models and methods to design silvicultural measures and estimate tree species suitability. Projectmanagement experiences, good skills in scientific writing, layout and design is expected and very good knowledge of German language (writing and spelling) is a requirement. Knowledge and application of geographical information systems (analysis of vector and raster data, visualisation), ability to analyse large amounts of data, knowledge and application of statistical and analytical tools as well as creation and adaptation of scripts (JavaScript, R) is an advantage.

Gross monthly salary and pay grade in terms of collective agreement for university staff (payable 14 times per year): B1, € 2.929,00 (for 40 hours per week)

University of Natural Resources and Life Sciences Vienna seeks to increase the number of its female faculty and staff members. Therefore qualified women are strongly encouraged to apply. In case of equal qualification, female candidates will be given preference unless reasons specific to an individual male candidate tilt the balance in his favour.

Please send your job application to the Personnel department, University of Natural Resources and Life Sciences, 1190 Vienna, Peter-Jordan-Straße 70; E-Mail: kerstin.buchmueller@boku.ac.at. (Reference code: 172)

We regret that we cannot reimburse applicants travel and lodging expenses incurred as part of the selection and hiring process.

www.boku.ac.at
Additional Information
Additional comments

Please note that the full job description is only available in German.

job_description:
Principal Scientist – Oncology PK/PD Modelling (m/f/d)-2010196

THE POSITION

As a family owned company with a long term commitment to improve human health we create Value through Innovation for our customers and are powered by our people. We are excited for the discovery of ground-breaking novel cancer treatments and believe that an organizational and individual desire for breakthrough discoveries is the key to identifying innovative First-in-Class medicine. To advance science we like to take ownership for decisions and actions, to make agile contributions with an open mind and come up with innovative ideas.

If you want join our breakthrough culture to build a successful career in mathematical and statistical modelling, and make a real difference to cancer patients and patient families worldwide, this is the right opportunity. The Discovery ADME Department within RCV is searching for a recognised expert to lead PK/PD modelling for oncology research in Vienna.

Tasks & responsibilities
Create value in discovery project teams by enabling decisions based on state-of-the art M&S approaches
Provide strategic leadership for the Department and with the colleagues globally in providing cutting edge M&S activities including impact on design of data acquisition, analytics, and reporting from pre-Lead Optimisation to clinical Proof of Concepts
Establish direction and objectives to maintain scientific leadership in data analysis and M&S approaches
Build strong expertise in predictive modelling relevant to PK/PD and pharmacometrics
Supervise other M&S scientists in the team
Foster organizational learning by linking into the internal network and translate Research knowledge to the clinics
Build and maintain external contacts and collaborations to enable access to the best talents and cutting-edge methodologies, and deliver to BI project work
Publish scientific work to contribute to global innovation
Requirements
University training in applied mathematics and statistics or PhD in modelling different biological systems, e.g. Systems Biology, Quantitative Systems Pharmacology, Pharmacometrics
At least 4 years of experience in a pharmaceutical setting with pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic modeling
Programming experience in languages like R, MATLAB, NONMEM, SAS, Python, Mathematica

job_description: At BIOMIN we harness the power of science to support animal health and performance. By applying state-of-the-art and proprietary technology we deliver natural, sustainable and profitable solutions to the livestock industry. For over 35 years we have pioneered innovative solutions for mycotoxin risk management and gut performance. BIOMIN is part of ERBER Group. In the gut performance further development role, you will work in a highly motivated team dedicated to developing innovative and sustainable feed additive solutions for the improvement of gut health, well-being and optimum performance of poultry, pigs, ruminants and aquaculture. You will use your technical knowledge to coordinate state-of-the-art in vitro and in vivo experiments and investigate the efficacy and mode of action of probiotics, phytogenics and acidifiers. Close collaboration and knowledge exchange with other departments and experts will keep your workday full of variety. Are you up to the challenge? We are Pioneers, Partners and Performers! 100% of trust in you and your skills in advance Structured on-boarding program for a good start into your new job Room to maneuver and for your personal development Exciting and challenging tasks in an international environment Strong support from your own and other teams across our organization Internal and external development programs Unique company culture, on first name terms from trainee to CEO Have a look at our Sustainability Report to get to know us even better. Here are some more good reasons to work for us. What else do you need to know? Reference Number: 655 You will be based in Getzersdorf (Austria) Your type of employment: 38.5 hours/week, full-time, permanent contract This position is available immediately however, we are happy to consider your notice period or your desired start date. Based on your classification in our ERBER Group career model, your professional experience and your qualification, we offer you an attractive total compensation package starting at EUR 40 000 gross p.a. Job Description - Principal Scientist – Oncology PK/PD Modelling (m/f/d) (2010196)
Boehringer Ingelheim is an equal opportunity global employer who takes pride in maintaining a diverse and inclusive culture. We embrace diversity of perspectives and strive for an inclusive environment which benefits our employees, patients and communities.
Principal Scientist – Oncology PK/PD Modelling (m/f/d)-2010196
THE POSITION


As a family owned company with a long term commitment to improve human health we create Value through Innovation for our customers and are powered by our people. We are excited for the discovery of ground-breaking novel cancer treatments and believe that an organizational and individual desire for breakthrough discoveries is the key to identifying innovative First-in-Class medicine. To advance science we like to take ownership for decisions and actions, to make agile contributions with an open mind and come up with innovative ideas.

If you want join our breakthrough culture to build a successful career in mathematical and statistical modelling, and make a real difference to cancer patients and patient families worldwide, this is the right opportunity. The Discovery ADME Department within RCV is searching for a recognised expert to lead PK/PD modelling for oncology research in Vienna.

Tasks & responsibilities
Create value in discovery project teams by enabling decisions based on state-of-the art M&S approaches
Provide strategic leadership for the Department and with the colleagues globally in providing cutting edge M&S activities including impact on design of data acquisition, analytics, and reporting from pre-Lead Optimisation to clinical Proof of Concepts
Establish direction and objectives to maintain scientific leadership in data analysis and M&S approaches
Build strong expertise in predictive modelling relevant to PK/PD and pharmacometrics
Supervise other M&S scientists in the team
Foster organizational learning by linking into the internal network and translate Research knowledge to the clinics
Build and maintain external contacts and collaborations to enable access to the best talents and cutting-edge methodologies, and deliver to BI project work
Publish scientific work to contribute to global innovation
Requirements
University training in applied mathematics and statistics or PhD in modelling different biological systems, e.g. Systems Biology, Quantitative Systems Pharmacology, Pharmacometrics
At least 4 years of experience in a pharmaceutical setting with pharmacokinetic and pharmacodynamic modeling
Programming experience in languages like R, MATLAB, NONMEM, SAS, Python, Mathematica
Previous drug discovery and development working experience, ideally in areas of oncology or immunology
Strategic and connective thinking
Excellent team work and communication skills to drive cross-functional collaboration and team success with various disciplines
Inquisitive and curious of new data and ideas, and persistent testing them out to find clear new paths to success quickly
Excellent presentation skills (English as a working language, basic German an advantage)
Your Benefits
Position specific training opportunities for your personal and professional growth
Comprehensive health promotion, sustaining your health in the best possible way
Additional off-days (bridge-days) for more leisure time
Company pension scheme, because your future matters
Staff restaurant with a variety of lunch options for your daily well-being
We offer an attractive salary package in line with your qualification, experience and individual competencies. The base pay is composed of a market oriented excess payment and the respective amount according to the Austrian collective agreement (at least € 60,000 gross per year/full-time).

WHY BOEHRINGER INGELHEIM?
Breakthrough therapies and innovative healthcare solutions for both humans and animals
As a family owned company, we take the long view and stand for stability and sustainability
Talented and ambitious teams, living innovation and growing together
50,000 employees globally, 2,600 in Vienna
Boehringer Ingelheim is an equal opportunity global employer who takes pride in maintaining a diverse and inclusive culture. We embrace diversity of perspectives and strive for an inclusive environment, which benefits our employees, patients and communities.

Business Data Analyst & Project Manager
Fuschl am See

Data is king when it comes to enabling business strategy and supporting decisions in a digital era. But there are at least 4 steps between data and decision support: understand what data is needed, source it, provision it and deliver it in an insightful and actionable way. At Red Bull we have created a Data team to seamlessly connect and operationalize these steps. Our unique asset, the Corporate Data Model, hubs all our data along the entire business value chain, from brand awareness to free cash flow. Since data increases its value with use, developing our Corporate Data Model is a constant fascinating adventure that keeps renewing every day. That is why we are looking for a new Business Data Analyst & Project Manager, a data savvy business person who supports cross-functional partners with understanding data needs, co-leads with IT data sourcing and provisioning up to the Corporate Data Model and lastly assists business teams to develop insights/support decisions.
UNDERSTAND BUSINESS AND DATA
Partner with business teams to figure out and develop new use cases for cross-functional reports. Identify data requirements in terms of business fit, availability, quality, consistency and frequency
DESIGN DATA SOURCING, MODELLING AND PROVISIONING
Think and conceptually design the integration of cross functionally relevant third party data; validate from business perspective the technical implementation realized by IT
OWN AND DEVELOP THE CORPORATE DATA MODEL FRAMEWORK
Review and approve all data integration projects to the Corporate Data Model initiated by business functions in order to ensure consistency and transparency; devise and drive the development of solutions to improve the usability of the Corporate Data Model
DEVELOP INSIGHTFUL AND ACTIONABLE REPORTS
Assist business partners to think, design and create insightful and actionable reports. Lead as business project manager the development of cross-functional reports
EXPERIENCE
Your areas of knowledge and expertise

that matter most for this role:

Professional experience in a business analyst or consulting project manager position
Excellent analytical skills and passionate with data
Hands-on experience with data models, data preparation and reporting solutions (ideally SAP BI, SQL/R/Phyton, SAP Analytics Cloud/Tableau/Power BI)
Strong communication and presentation skills
Enthusiastic learner, exceptionally curious, proactive, self-motivated and directed, team player
Responsible and able to work with different projects in parallel in a fast-paced environment
University degree or equivalent, ideally Economics, Business Administration, Computer Science or Statistics

job_title_orig: Laboratory Scientist Oncology Translation Science (m/f/d) - 2 years fixed-term contract
job_description:
Job Description - Laboratory Scientist Oncology Translation Science (m/f/d) - 2 years fixed-term contract (208742)
Boehringer Ingelheim is an equal opportunity global employer who takes pride in maintaining a diverse and inclusive culture. We embrace diversity of perspectives and strive for an inclusive environment which benefits our employees, patients and communities.
Laboratory Scientist Oncology Translation Science (m/f/d) - 2 years fixed-term contract-208742
With immediate effect, we are searching a highly motivated Lab Scientist with strong communication skills, who is an exceptional team-worker. This position will strengthen our multi-disciplinary research team focused on translational and biomarker-related aspects in drug development for cancer patients. It offers a unique possibility to work at the forefront of the development of novel targeted as well as immune-oncology based therapies.

Duties & Responsibilities
Independent planning, coordination, implementation, analysis and documentation of in vitro and ex vivo experiments
Characterization of biomarkers for novel therapeutic approaches, supporting the development of novel cancer drugs with molecular and cellular biology expertise
Analysis of signalling networks in cancer cell with a focus on novel approaches aimed towards clinical implementation
Experience in cancer immunology-related techniques is an advantage
Close collaboration with colleagues from various functions, eps. histopathology and cell based assays
Training/supervision of students
Requirements
Master’s degree in a relevant discipline (e.g. molecular biology, genetics, cancer immunology)
Experience with independently planning, performing and documenting in vitro and ex vivo experiments
Experience with cell culture, protein and RNA analysis
Strong scientific interest incl. literature search etc.
Willingness to assume responsibility in a matrix in a global department
Your Benefits
Position specific training opportunities for your personal and professional growth
Comprehensive health promotion, sustaining your health in the best possible way
Additional off-days (bridge-days) for more leisure time
Staff restaurant with a variety of lunch options for your daily well-being

For this position we offer an interesting salary package considering your expertise and personal competencies as well as your professional experience. We are obliged by law to state the minimum salary according to the collective agreement, which amounts to € 37,016.14 gross per year (full-time) for this position, whereby an overpayment is possible.

Effects of COVID-19
We will continue to hire talented people and we look forward to receiving your applications. As a result of COVID-19, we have introduced alternative working arrangements to ensure that our employees can stay safe and healthy. At all company locations, we work remotely whenever possible. For applicants, virtual video interviews will initially take place. During the limited in-person interviews we still have during this time, we pay special attention to distance and the recommended hygiene rules. We warmly welcome new employees to our 3-day onboarding event, which takes place in the form of an online event.
Who we are
At Boehringer Ingelheim we create value through innovation with one clear goal: to improve the lives of patients. We develop breakthrough therapies and innovative healthcare solutions in areas of unmet medical need for both humans and animals. As a family owned company we focus on long term performance. We are powered by 50.000 employees globally who nurture a diverse, collaborative and inclusive culture. Learning and development for all employees is key, because your growth is our growth.
Want to learn more? Visit boehringer-ingelheim.com and join us in our effort to make more health.

Contact
Your HR Recruiting Manager for this position is Doris Staribacher.

We are looking forward to receiving your application via our application portal so that we can treat your data confidentially and in compliance with the GDPR.

On our career site you will find many interesting facts about us as an employer as well as information about the application process or our diverse divisions. Take a look behind the scenes and get an insight into our day-to-day business.

job_title_orig: Senior Scientist (m/f/d) for Urban Climate Simulation and Impact Assessment
job_description:
We are Austria’s largest research and technology organisation and an international player in applied research for innovative infrastructure solutions. This makes us a powerful development partner for industry and a top employer in the scientific community. Our Center for Energy is seeking to hire new Ingenious Partners for our location in Vienna:
Senior Scientist (m/f/d) for Urban Climate Simulation and Impact Assessment
Digital Resilient Cities
You will be part of a multidisciplinary team focusing on the development of new approaches and solutions for climate-responsive cities around the world.
You will be pioneering new ways how cities can combat climate change with novel methods.
You lead a group of experts and closely work with our team of urban planners, data scientists, environmental experts as well as water and energy specialists.
You design, acquire and lead national/European research as well as client projects.
You push the boundaries of cutting-edge regional, urban and microclimate simulation by co-developing and improving climate models.
You extract regional climate simulation results as forcing data for our model runs to perform impact analysis and assessments for various urban scales.
You explore and interpret climate change signals not only as time series but as spatial patterns, comparing historical data with future climate scenarios.
You develop climate adaptation and resilience strategies for regional and urban scales applying climate models tailored to the local needs.
You motivate, lead and develop an interdisciplinary team of researchers and supervise PhDs.
You become a known player in the Austrian and European urban climate research community.
You publish the findings from research projects in top peer-reviewed journals and present research result at international conferences.
Your qualifications as an Ingenious Partner*:
PhD in Meteorology, applied physics or related disciplines
Several years of proven experience in regional, urban and microclimate simulations and climate models for different scales (e.g. WARF, Cosmo CLM and Palm4you, Solweig, Envimet, Grasshopper tools)
Profound knowledge in the assessment of climate models and the exploration of simulation results
Experience in analysing extreme events and climate hazards through spatial impact and risk assessment
Proven experience in developing and managing complex research projects and proven competence in leading and developing teams in a research environment
Proven track of scientific publications and experience in conducting workshops and scientific talks
Very good communication and presentation skills in German and English

What to expect:
The minimum gross annual salary according to the collective agreement is EUR 61.320,-.The actual salary will be determined individually, based on your qualifications and experience. In addition, we offer company benefits, flexible working conditions, individual training and career opportunities.

At AIT, the promotion of women is important to us - that's why we are especially looking forward to hearing from female applicants!

Please submit your application documents including CV, motivational letter and certificates online.

Synchronizing Healthcare
Werden Sie jetzt ein Teil davon!

Daten sammeln ist das eine. Wissen, was man mit ihnen tut, das andere. Anstatt auf eine Glaskugel zu vertrauen, bauen Sie für Ihre KundInnen die optimale SAP Analytics-Lösung. Aus einer Datenflut werden strukturierte, wettbewerbsrelevante Informationen, die strategische Entscheidungen für Ihre KundInnen leichter machen.

Ihre Aufgaben umfassen:
Sie blicken tief in die Systemarchitekturen, Prozesse und Anforderungen Ihrer KundInnen
Sie analysieren und identifizieren rasch die relevanten Vorgänge und Daten
Sie erkennen Abhängigkeiten und konstruieren Datenmodelle – mit SAP HANA, SAP BW/4 HANA, SAP Anlytics Cloud und Business Objects
Sie designen und entwickeln den nötigen Unternehmenssteuerungsprozess – strategisch und operativ
Sie implementieren die optimale BI-Lösung eigenständig im Rahmen eines Experten-Teams

All das machen Sie remote und teilweise bei KundInnen vor Ort. Auf Reisen sind Sie bis zu 50% Ihrer Arbeitszeit.

Das bringen Sie mit:
Sie arbeiten seit mind. 3 Jahren als SAP BI Consultant oder ABAP Developer
Sie steigern die Performance Ihrer KundInnen durch Modellieren von BW oder HANA,
Sie sind fit in ABAP oder SQL
Sie können Lumira, Analysis Office und SAP Analytics Cloud bedienen
Sie erfassen Zusammenhänge und betriebswirtschaftliche Prozesse rasch und können sie gut analysieren
Sie sprechen und schreiben Deutsch und Englisch.
Im Optimalfall können Sie mit BW-IP oder BPC Planungslösungen gestalten, haben Erfahrung mit den Modulen FI/CO oder MM/SD und haben Erfahrung in Projekt- und Prozessmanagement.
Das bringen wir mit:
Interessante Entwicklungsperspektiven und spannende, herausfordernde Projekte im nationalen oder internationalen Umfeld
Teamorientierte und offene, sehr gute Unternehmenskultur sowie angenehmes Betriebsklima

Kundenorientierung
„Die Herausforderungen, denen wir uns in den Projekten als SAP Analytics Team bei Phoron jeden Tag stellen, sind vielfältig und technisch wie inhaltlich sehr spannend. Durch die permanente Unterstützung in motivierten Teams macht es Spaß, kreative Lösungen zu finden und die Erfahrung weiterzutragen.“
Thomas, Unit Manager Analytics

Sie steigen bei uns in ein Team von Experten-KollegInnen ein. Unsere positive Geschäftsentwicklung, erfolgreiche Projektergebnisse und zufriedene KundInnen sind das eine, unser lernoffenes, amikales Klima das andere.
Entwicklungsperspektiven, Schulungen, Zusatzleistungen, monatliche MA-Events, sportliche und soziale Aktivitäten... Machen Sie sich am besten selbst ein Bild.

Wir freuen uns, wenn Sie ins Team kommen und bieten Ihnen für diese Position ein Bruttojahresgehalt inkl. leistungsabhängiger Prämie ab € 60.000,-. Sie können mehr? Wir sehen uns Ihre berufliche Qualifikation und Erfahrung an. Abhängig davon ist eine marktkonforme Überzahlung möglich.

Sie haben Spaß an neuen beruflichen Herausforderungen, möchten Ihre Karriere bei uns starten und mit den besten Köpfen und einem exzellenten Team zusammenarbeiten? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre aussagekräftige Bewerbung inkl. Lebenslauf mit Foto, Gehaltswunsch und frühestmöglichem Eintrittsdatum.

Organizational Setting

The objective of the Department of Nuclear Energy (NE) is to foster the efficient and safe use of nuclear power by supporting interested Member States in: improving the performance of nuclear power plants, the nuclear fuel cycle, and the management of nuclear wastes; catalysing innovation in nuclear power and fuel cycle technologies; developing indigenous capabilities around the world for national energy planning; deploying new nuclear power plants; preserving and disseminating nuclear information and knowledge; and advancing science and industry through improved operation of research reactors.

The department has a dynamic, participative and interactive operating environment with inputs received from the Board of Governors, the General Conference, policy and decision-makers, and technical counterparts in Member States and the international development community.

The Division of Nuclear Power comprises the Nuclear Power Engineering Section, the Nuclear Power Technology Development Section, the Nuclear Infrastructure Development Section and the INPRO (International Project on Innovative Nuclear Reactors and Fuel Cycles) Section. The Division provides core engineering, technological, human resource development and management support to interested Member States in the field of nuclear power.

The Nuclear Power Engineering Section (NPES) assists interested Member States in the development of the safe and effective operation of nuclear power plants and in the expansion of existing nuclear programmes. It provides guidance and encourages information exchange on engineering aspects of design, construction, commissioning, operations, maintenance, decommissioning; management and management systems; human resource development and performance improvement; expansion planning and strategies; and stakeholder involvement.

Main Purpose

As a member of the Nuclear Power Engineering Section(NPES), the Nuclear Power Data Analyst contributes to the development, maintenance and validation of the databases, manages web-applications, implements nuclear power plant production related projects and publishes technical documents in order to contribute to the IAEA's overall objective of fostering the exchange of information.

The Nuclear Power Data Analyst supports the ongoing development and recommends improvement of database structures and links between datasets; monitors and reports on the quality and maintains the update of the relevant websites linked to the databases. He/she develops analysis tools in order to enhance IAEA research, reporting and presentations that incorporate data.

Role

The Nuclear Power Data Analyst is: (1) a technical expert, working with NPES team to support and enhance the effectiveness of collaboration in nuclear engineering development amongst Agency staff and experts in Member States; to implement and maintain technical databases and applications; (2) a custodian and a supporter of several databases and applications, including Power Reactor Information System (PRIS) and Country Nuclear Power Profiles (CNPP) database; (3) a network collecting, reviewing and disseminating the information by establishing networks; (4) a developer of several databases and their web sites; and (5) a responsible scientific secretary for nuclear power engineering projects and documents.

Functions / Key Results Expected
Support PRIS database and, its services and production of related IAEA publications.
Maintain and disseminate information of the Country Nuclear Power Profiles.
Support and maintain other nuclear power operation related databases and applications.
Provide statistical analysis of data for IAEA research, publications, presentations and reports.
Plan and organize meetings and exchange of information prepare technical reports and other publications on engineering issues and databases.
Provide technical management and support for TC projects as Technical Officer, develop strategy/action plans to achieve project milestones, organize and participate in seminars, workshops, expert missions, training courses, meetings with Member State counterparts concerning project progress and implementation.
Carry out networking/information exchanges at the IAEA, with the Member States and international organizations.
Maintain close cooperation with national and international organization in the area of engineering and power reactor information.
Competencies and Expertise

Core Competencies

Qualifications, Experience and Language skills
A first level university degree in engineering or related field.
At least five years of working experience in the field of nuclear energy, of which four years of experience with nuclear power data/web site development/maintenance.
Proven experience in nuclear power data management is required.
Experience with the creation and maintenance of databases, including data/information collection and dissemination is required.
Experience with data mining and statistical analysis, for example using SQL, programming XML, JavaScript, or ETL frameworks.
Experience in data visualization/presentation is required.
Excellent oral and written command of English. Knowledge of other official IAEA languages (Arabic, Chinese, French, Russian and Spanish) is an asset.
Remuneration

The IAEA offers an attractive remuneration package including a tax-free annual net base salary starting at US $60962 (subject to mandatory deductions for pension contributions and health insurance), a variable post adjustment which currently amounts to US $ 31578*, dependency benefits, rental subsidy, education grant, relocation and repatriation expenses; 6 weeks' annual vacation, home leave, pension plan and health insurance
